description:
Randomly found this place when visiting the area.  Place was busy which is always a good sign.  It's also the first time we found street parking so quickly in SF.

The Latte's were great (I ended up getting two) and the wife got a Tea Au Lait.  The Jalapeno Cheddar Corn Muffin and Chocolate Scone was a bit dry still decent.

Matcha Latte's seem to be getting good reviews so we'll have to try that next time we're in town.
author: Luke D.

description:
I got the Snowy Plover, which is what everyone seems to rave about for this place and what was the Instagram shot for the day. Unfortunately, while it looked pretty, I thought it was disgusting!

You're basically drinking an espresso soda, with sweetener in it, and some whip cream on top. The whole thing was disgusting, and tasted really off, especially the sweetener that comes with the espresso soda. It was just an unusual and unpleasant sensation.

The best part of the drink though was the whipped cream, that was amazing and tasted really good. If I could do it over I'd just ask for an espresso shot with the whipped cream, and I would have loved it a lot.

Even when mixing the whipped cream in, it only made the drink marginally better, and it wasn't enough to carry the otherwise crappy drink.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Delicious coffee. Long line on weekends. Really long line on weekends. Well, I guess if you stand there and time it right it gets a little bit less long but it's still long. I do however really like that they serve your food pretty much to you immediately after you order.  that's part of why the line is so long, but once you order you pretty much don't have to wait.

They've expanded their food menu. They used to just have pastries - which were pretty good. Looks like now they have breakfast sandwiches. I didn't get one but they looked good and I'd like to come back and try one.

It's a real small space. There is one table inside which can fit probably 5 to 6 people. Then there is some seating along the hallway to the bathroom but it's very crowded. There are also a few tables outside. But certainly not enough seating for how many people this place gets.

But yeah great coffee. Totally worth the wait. After all it's a weekend and what better to do than wait in line with a friend for a good coffee?
author: Sarah C.

description:
If you like really strong coffee, like REALLY strong, Andytown is the place to go. 

Not really a good place to sit and get work done. There's one "big" (seats about 4-5 people) table inside and 1-2 tables inside that seat up to 2 people. Theres a few tables outside but no shade it'll either be too bright to sit out or too windy/cold. 

Anyways, I came with a group of 12 people and we literally took half the chairs in the outside seating area. My fiance got the iced coffee which was REALLY strong. I think I could've added a full cup of water and it could still be strong. They also have paper straws (bring your own straws) for the cold drinks, which ended up getting soggy after like 5 minutes of drinking your coffee. 

It's in a quiet neighborhood (At least it was on Sunday around 2pm) so there was lots of parking available.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Mind blown from the snowy plover. Also tried my friend's matcha plover and loved that as well. This place is lit!
Kudos to Andytown for differentiating themselves in the sea of coffee shops in the world by creating this clever and memorable drink. Just sad they don't have any shops in my hometown.
author: Devin O.

description:
It's always cold in the Sunset, but never too cold for Snowy Plovers!! I also don't usually start off my day with iced coffee (I have this unspoken rule about not drinking anything cold before noon..), but I was happy to make an exception today! :)

I've always been a fan of espresso with tonic, so this drink was definitely on my radar, and I'm so glad I tried it. The little bit of brown sugar syrup was just sweet enough to cut the bitterness of the espresso but not so much that I couldn't enjoy the strong aroma of the Andytown roast. The homemade whipped cream was also really, really good! I'm not even usually a fan of whipped cream, and typically order my drinks without it, but I loved the texture of theirs! I think I will be requesting it in all of my future drinks, even if it isn't included. :9

I had the cheddar bacon scone for breakfast, which was quite tasty, but pricey for what it was. I think the next time I visit, it will just be for the coffee. I'm excited to bring my coffee-loving friends here though!

In terms of the cafe itself, it is pretty tiny with one larger communal table and a few counter seats. I'm not sure if they have outdoor seating year round, but they did today, which is where I sat to enjoy my breakfast. Otherwise, this cafe is probably better as a grab-to-go type of place than somewhere to sit and do work.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Was slightly underwhelmed by this place. It's got a lovely neighborhood feel but it's not great for getting work done or relaxing with a book unless you sit outside in your space. It gets super crowded and it's a small shop so it's not the easiest to move around. 

That said, $3.25 for a small drip is a bit steep, though the $1 refills are a nice option. The drip itself is solid, very smooth when it cools down, but didn't blow me away. The chocolate chips though are pretty dope, and they're perfect snack size.
author: Jason S.

description:
Andytown Coffee Roasters is a cute small coffee shop with some great tasting drinks. 

Parking: 
From the looks of it, you can park at the streets cost free. My family and I went here Sunday morning at around 8:30, which could have contributed to the slow flow of traffic inside the coffee shop, as well as the relative ease of finding a parking spot just in front of the cafe. 

Drinks:
I got the Early Bird and my parents both got the cappuccino. So the Early Bird has a certain fizz to it, and flavor-wise, there is some uniqueness to it that not everyone would like. I personally lie somewhere in the middle, leaning a little bit towards me liking it. I think what stole the show was the cappuccino. They tasted flavorful and strong. My only complaint is that they're a bit small in size...but then again, it is a cappuccino, so really I'm just being greedy. 

Do note that there's an extra charge for Almond milk. 

Overall, it was a pretty nice place, with pretty nice service and some pretty nice drinks.
author: Cassey Z.

description:
Got here on a Saturday around 4pm for a quick coffee break with a friend and we ended up getting both The Original Bird and Matcha Plover. 

Both these drinks are quite unique - the coffee is super bubbly. It's definitely a one time try for me. However the fresh homemade whipped cream on top of the drinks is super good. 

Overall this place is super cute. Parking is easy to find. But the drinks are a little expensive - but that's Bay Area for you! I will defiantly come back to try their other drinks!
author: Stacey Y.

description:
What they're famous for: The Snowy Plover. It is quite good. Espresso+Sparkling Water+Homemade Whip Cream=WAHBAHM SHAZAM BOOM BAAM SHATTER CRASH WOW!

I could imagine it being ideal on a hot day. 

The place itself gets pretty crowded. I had to squeeze next to a neighbor (leave room for Jesus). Their wi-fi is pretty solid.

Note: There's a lot of free parking around since Andy's is located in the middle of a residential area.
author: Christine H.

description:
This hip little coffee shop in the outer sunset is exactly what you'd think it would be: cool, clean and nicely hipster. They boast a small menu of breakfast pastries, toast and sandwiches but, the coffee is the star. 

The cold brew was punchy and delicious. Served in a pint glass with ice was a great way to be able and experience all it's aromas. The toast I ordered beside it was reminiscent of Irish soda bread as it was dense and slightly crumbly. The butter was also quite good but, it lacked salt. Drop some salt crystals on that butter and you've got a winner. 

It's a great place to work as the outside seating is anything but distracting and the neighborhood people watching is legit. I love it out there...
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Andytown has two locations.

Video sketch of both shops on Lawton and Taraval.
https://youtu.be/GsB8NqqwKjA

This store on Lawton has a warmer feeling to it compared to the one on Taraval. (Maybe because of the lighting they use) It only has one big table near the entrance and 4 small tables with stools in the back. Outside you'll find more tables for 4 available. 

If you want a more cozy experience goto this location. Goto the Taraval street shop if you enjoy cool & minimalistic vibe. 

Menu is pretty extensive with coffee, tea, soda bread, etc.. and their snowy plover. Both shops are very compact, but since the area is chill most of the times...you'll find a seat easily. Coffee is great and I always stop by when I come to the beach side once in a while.
author: Dee K.

description:
Walked over on a Thursday afternoon to find a short line and pretty much full shop. I think it's a nice place to catch up with a friend or two but not really a place to get some work done (unless all your work is on a laptop & you're not the sprawling type) because the tables are REALLY small on the inside - save for one moderate one when you first walk in. There's a bit of seating outside as well but even on a weekday afternoon all these seats were taken. 

Now on to the drinks. Generally, I don't like drinks topped with whipped cream but the whipped cream here is oh so gooooood! I got the original Snowy Plover and while I enjoyed the combination of espresso and & sparkling water, the real winner was that sizeable dollop of whipped cream on top. SO creamy it almost feels wrong!! I probably ate a good chunk of that before even starting my drink. 

The price seems pretty reasonable at $5 before tip & I would say is competitive with other coffee spots in the area. 

Will definitely be stopping by again to try the matcha version!
author: Janice L.

description:
Matcha lattes here are bomb! They're always busy so if you're in a rush come earlier. I only tried their snowy plover once and it wasn't what I expected in a good way. Think super fizzy coffee with addicting whip cream lol. Pastries are also good but they change everyday.
Service is always friendly and drinks come out fast. No wonder they're always so busy! ;)
author: Debby N.

description:
I was recommended by a friend to come here and try the original bird snowy plover. I got here early afternoon and the line was out the door, so I immediately thought, okay this will be worth the wait. The line moved very smoothly and pretty quickly, got both my drinks within 5 minutes. The original bird was something totally different than what I normally drink. It has cream soda mixed inside the coffee, so if you don't like cream soda or anything sparkling, this probably would not be right for you. I love sparkling water, so this was something different and tasty for me. Swirling around the whipped cream gave the coffee a creamy, light milky taste. 

The avocado toast came out to be around $10, but it was most certainly DELICIOUS. Just the right amount of salt and chili flakes. Oh, the bread that the avocado spread was on? SPOT ON. Oh yeah, thumbs up for paper straws too!
author: Rita L.

description:
Plovers plovers plovers!!! Snowy or March, get your Plover!

I like both (the coffee version and the Matcha), with the large dallop of thick cream on top, not to mention the sparkling water it comes with. I will admit, it was a bit odd at first, but given I love La Croix, I got to love it :D. 

I personally don't like mixing the cream into the liquid completely, but rather blend a bit as I go. Pick your fave way of drinking your plover! 

Oh, their baked goods are also delicious!
author: Giovanna R.

description:
Even though we live in outer Richmond - this has become our local go-to spot. I used to hit up trouble, but after feeling more and more unwelcome there it was time to move on.

Enter Andytown.

My wife loves the snowy plover. Let that also be the headline here because that is really the reason we go, I can make better coffee at home (because I make great coffee at home). 

All drinks are on point, and the breakfast sandwiches and soda bread treats are pretty good. The line can be long but it moves pretty good. 

Staff is mostly friendly, there's a select few who seem "over it" but it's gotta be tough to be one of six people crammed into the 100sqft behind the counter.
author: Ross H.

description:
In love with their Snowy Plovers! The combination of sparkling water and espresso shot definitely tasted better than I expected, and their homemade whipped cream just takes it to the next level.

The Snowy Plovers come in its original form (espresso shot), decaf, Matcha, or Huckleberry. My favorite by far is the Matcha - perfectly sweet and so refreshing. If you're feeling something non-caffeinated and fruity, I recommend trying the Huckleberry. The menu also covers your typical espresso drinks, tea, and some cool pastries!

Service is friendly. The place has some indoor and outdoor seating, but is quite cramped in general. Would be nice if there were more standing space. Regardless, one of the great gems Sunset has to offer!
author: Winnie N.

description:
YUM! 

Fizzy plover coffee to wake you up in the morning! I never thought I'd like a fizzy, cold brew styled drink with whipped cream....but it was just what I needed.

I wish I had also tried the matcha version!

*Loooong line on Saturday mornings but they move fast.
author: Briana L.

description:
I got the Irish bread with Irish white cheddar, homemade butter and apple butter. I also got the snowy plover...I think that's the name. It was a carbonated coffee with this AMAZING whipped cream. Probably on of the best coffee drinks I have ever had. The bread was really good. Pretty legit compared to Irish soda bread I've had in Ireland Cheese was perfect with the delicious apple butter. My mom makes the best apple butter... well did  unfortunately I accidentally dropped it on the ground  and lost most of it. Inside is really small! I wanted to sit outside anyways (they have about 5 small tables outside), but it ended up getting really cold and I wish there would have been room inside. 
The only reason I didn't give 5 starts is because it was really expensive, in my opinion. especially the apple butter add on...especially since I dropped it 
Employees were very nice. 

Beware of parking on the street! Each street has a different cleaning day, so you have to pay attention to the signs.
author: Loni R.

description:
Blah. That summarizes my experience. 

I'll start by saying it was a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't busy. I had one person behind me and just one ahead of me. When I got to order I was super rushed by the moody guy at the register! I am not a regular.. and didn't know what I wanted. He kept asking what we wanted. I told him, hold on we're still looking at the menu... we even offered the person behind us go ahead but they were on the same boat! He then keeps asking ok, what do you want, for here or to go. 
Listen.. I'm not looking for a red carpet and a golden invitation to enjoy your coffee shop.. but a bit of patience when I'm just trying to read your menu would be nice. 

We ordered a capuccino and a cafe au lait and they came out quicker than we could finish ordering. The espresso was bitter and tasted like it was made from burnt beans- just not a good cup of joe. The drip coffee was acidic and mild all in one, also not a good cup of joe. Overall... not a fantastic coffee experience.
author: Nadia H.

description:
I was able to finish my drink (this is always a good sign)

It's a little funny because their Iced Matcha Latte isn't listed on their menu but is available to order

Their matcha latte is different than other matcha latte shops because their matcha... is tangy/sparkling haha not what I expecting when taking my first sip

about $5.xx and only 16oz cup

I'd recommend to try once if you're in the area and it seems their other items are very popular - I don't think I'll be back though and wanted to give a heads up to anyone who thinks it may be the matcha latte that isn't sparkling
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Finally came out to the Sunset to try this spot out - everyone raves about the Snowy Plover so I had to get that. It was pretty good (espresso and sparkling water has an interesting texture if you don't mind bubbles in your coffee) but not amazing - maybe it's just been hyped up. The hand-whipped cream however is divine. The problem with getting it to go is that I got a paper straw -___- which are the worst, so really prevented me from getting the full experience.

Protip: even if you are getting the snowy plover to-go, don't use a straw or lid, just sip it for the full experience.
author: Farrah N.

description:
"It's "just" coffee and a muffin!" Says my "friends" 

My friends suck. 

No, it isn't JUST coffee and a muffin you mermaid green and white cup cultist. You be quiet you *wink. 

Coffee is as personal a beverage as wine. It isn't just the type of bean - it is also the roast. You know this because you're smart. 

Smart people drink coffee from places that serve the beans with the roast that they like.

The mermaid cup place is ok when you need a caffeine jolt. 

But when I can choose where to get my cup of coffee, convenience be damned, you can find me here or Philz! 

It's not just a cup of coffee and a muffin. It's everything I could ever want first thing in the morning...and then some!
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Andytown is definitley a gem of a coffeeshop in SF. Their location in Outer Sunset is bright and airy with a relaxed ambiance. 

They are known for their Snowy Plover which is a concoction of Pellegrino, two shots of Andytown's espresso, brown-sugar syrup served over ice and topped with a dollop of their homemade whipped cream. Yes, the SP isn't for everyone but, in my opinion it's delicious, refreshing and an interesting take on a coffee beverage. Plus that whipped cream is absolutely phenomenal!

If you're in the mood for something more standard, their drip coffee is a fantastic option. And don't forget about the pastries and muffins! I feel like they're underrated but definitely worth trying. 

They also sell freshly roasted, whole beans and a selection of commuter mugs.
author: Bailey K.

description: I wish this place were my little secret, but i also want the world to know about Andytown. Every time I come back home from school, or from a trip, this is my first stop. The mood here, and of course the snowy plover, ground me, and remind me of how special and close to my heart the outer sunset is. It certainly is a trek if you live anywhere in the city except the sunset, but it's so worth it!
author: Sophia W.

description:
This is my favorite and go-to coffee spot in the Bay Area. I would drive 45 mins from the East Bay to come here. Not only is their coffee great, they have delicious pastries as well. 

I'm very big into sparkling water so getting the Snowy Plover was a no-brainer. I don't see many sparkling espresso drinks so this place is very special! And not to mention their housemade whipped cream...that stuff is so ridiculously good. They also have a Matcha Plover, which is a nice non-coffee alternative. 

So pastries. All I've had so far here are their corn muffins. I've yet to try their other ones, but their corn muffins are amazing - I recommend the cheddar jalapeño one. 

I'm eagerly waiting for my next trip there. Probably sometime soon.
author: Tammie H.

description:
From the contemporary and rustic design to the unique variety of coffee drinks and pastries (i.e. Persimmon & sage cornbread muffin!), this little coffee shop is everything you never thought you'd need in the Outer Sunset District! 

I hear a lot about their Snowy Plover drink which is backed by many raving reviews. Definitely give that a shot. I'm pretty boring myself so I'll usually just grab a cup of drip coffee. It tastes like a light roast (citrus and acidic) but also feels very strong -- so if you had a rough start to your morning, grab a cuppa this before you head out for the day! 

I personally feel like one thing Andytown should be recognized for is their selection of pastries (which you can see them continuing to make fresh in the back!). Their cornbread muffins are moist, fluffy and always filled with interesting fruit and herb combinations! 

My one gripe about this tiny joint is that it's.....well....tiny. There are a few "bar tables" along their wall and 1 community table near the front. I'm not a "grab-n-go" type of guy so I definitely enjoy having the option of sitting down to have a little one-on-one time with my cup of caffeine and joy. 

Also, fun fact, they have treats in a jar by the entrance for your doggo pals to enjoy too so bring them with you!
author: Greg Y.

description:
Started as a huge fan of Andytown, but with recent price increases and  declining level of customer service, I've def become less of a fan. The price increase makes sense, SF is outrageously expensive and no matter the quiet corner of the City you call home. The 3-stars is solely based on the staff's declining service standards...

I get that people don't want work at coffee shops as their forever job. Totally understandable, but while you are working that job, can you try and give the customer just a tad more attention?

There have been early morning visits where the staff is more focused on their phones and hot goss-sessions than taking an order from customers. I mean, I don't want to interact with you either, just take my order, I'll pay, and hell I'll even tip, but don't leave us hanging at the counter wondering if we should just blurt our order out and thrust money at you.

Pro-tip: go right when they open to avoid the lines and try the whip cream just once, the pinch of salt goes a long way! Coffee is tasty and strong, def get your money's worth on the caffeine front.
author: Brandon J.

description:
Am I obsessed with Andytown? Yes. I love their "Snowy Plovers" and crave them constantly. I prefer the original but pretty often I'll switch it out and order the Matcha snowy plover. Both are awesome and refreshing. I am soooooo happy Andytown makes them for me to enjoy. The combination of the whip cream and sparkling water with the espresso is genius. 

Bye bye Starbucks, all my $ and cravings to Andytown now. Happy to support the locals and happy this coffee company is in SF!

There are multiple locations so sometimes I will go to the Taraval st (2 locations really close to each other) knowing the Lawton one typically has a line out the door. 

The pastries aren't bad if you need a snack with your coffee but mmm mmm mmm those Snowy Plovers are simply the best.
author: Cicely T.

description: Lovely latte and opens on labor day - what's not to love? The place is clean and the staff is friendly and fast with serving the customers. Their matcha latte is delicious without too much sugar in it. For me this is the right balance of sweetness. I'm not a coffee person so their regular latte with double shots is too bitter for me. I would stick to their matcha latte.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I'll save you the reading time and just flat-out tell you I am not a huge fan of the Snowy Plover.

I'm still giving this place 5 stars because I think it's very clean, well-lit, and just a great spot for coffee or a date. Parking is pretty damn easy and the wait isn't too long. The store is small and cramped inside but they make it work and it looks great. Service was nice and they do their best to keep the line going. 

Now the Snowy Plover. I'm not a huge fan because I usually have espresso by itself or with milk. Much like most of you people reading this, I have never had espresso with sparkling water nor have I ever known of that flavor combination's existence. It is definitely an interesting taste and although it isn't horrid, it isn't something I would go out of my way to get. Even if I was in the area, I'm pretty sure I'd stick with a latte or just plain coffee. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't like an absolutely disgusting taste. I still finished the drink and thought it was decent, but it's been like 3 days and I'm still confused with what I tasted. 

Definitely please mix in the cream before you drink it.
author: Kyle L.

description:
One of my favorite coffee places in sf! The snowy plover is very different than what I've ever had before in terms of coffee. It has an after taste that's very soda-like and the whipped cream gives it an extra kick at the end ...great combination. 

Ps: they make their tea super hot though. Literally waited 30 mins for it to cool down to drink.
author: Caitlin P.

description: Yes please! Snowy plover lives up to the hype and that whipped cream... ohhh emmm geee. My husband and I had to literally stop on the side of the road to take a moment to enjoy those last few licks of whipped cream at the end of our snowy plovers. It. That. Good. We loved Andytown so much that we went back with our friends the next day. "Another snowy please!" I also really appreciated how friendly and prompt service was both visits. This place is busy and there will likely be a line when you visit, but they move quickly. I tried their orange and choco chip scone and it was very yummy. My girlfriend who is an excellent baker tried the mini chocolate muffin and she enjoyed it as well! I look forward to returning! Delish!
author: Jenice M.

description:
I was in town for work and to see friends. My best friend insisted on taking me here before my flight out as she was obsessed with the Snow Plow (that's how *I* heard the name). She said she would drive to this location three times a week to get that drink. 

The thought of espresso being poured over sparkling water didn't appeal to me. At all. I drink sparkling water several times a day. Plain. And that's it. So her explanation of the drink was weird.

We had just had breakfast maybe 1.5 hours prior (with coffee) but hey, why not get more caffeine in me before going to the airport. 

The location is small but quaint. The line wasn't too bad to order. 

It was nice watching them make the Snowy Plover right in front of you. The two drinks were about $10 after tax.

You can request the drink without the simple syrup (which is what I did for mine).

The presentation is pretty. Friend mixed her whipped cream into her drink. I didn't do that and opted to try the drink without the cream incorporated into it (at first). 

I felt the drink tasted sour. Or strangely tart. It was a different taste that I wasn't used to or fond of. Friend insisted that I mix the whipped cream in. The cream didn't look all that yummy once it was mixed in. And yeah, it did cross my mind if I received a bad batch of cream after reading the reviews. But my stomach was fine so I doubt that. 

So perhaps the SP wasn't my drink but I'd happily return to try another coffee in the future.
author: Faye L.

description:
Without a doubt one of my favorite coffee shops not only in the Bay Area, but in general.

To be honest, I had Andytown in my bookmarks for quite a while since although I am in San Francisco about once a week, Andytown is a way's out there- nestled in the Outer Sunset. However, I decided to make the trek there from the East Bay one day and it turned out to be an amazing decision! 

When you get to Andytown, there will more likely than not be a line. Do not despair, as the line moves pretty quick due to their employees always having a tight grip on their efficiency :) 

They have a fairly limited menu, but they are great at what they do, so you really can't go wrong with any of their choices. While I have not tried their signature drink (the snowy plover), I can attest to their mochas and lattes. 

About 90% of the times that I've gone to Andytown, I've gotten a mocha. The chocolate that they use for their mocha is amazing- it has just the right amount of sweetness and richness without being overly indulgent. Their lattes are also amazing, you can really taste the quality of the beans that they use.

Just a little side note- Andytown is NOT a place in which you will be able to do work. While they do have free wi-fi, there isn't very much space to plop yourself there for hours on end. However, the location is amazing- right by Sunset Beach. Would definitely recommend a stroll on over there once you have your caffeine and pastries :)
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
So yah, stupid me would order their signature Snowy Plover w/Almond Milk. "Have you had one before? / No. / So we don't put 'milk' in our Plover but we can add in addition to". Only then did it snap into my head that this was one of those tonic/espresso dealies some of the cafes are concocting in DTSJ. 

It was tolerable. Still an acquired taste. I took the advice of a friend on this page and mixed it right before driving up to Lands End this morning and it got me going to and fro the 1.7 mi trail and extra.

Double Shotty Menu's good, pastry spread is better; but can I take some time to just talk about their detail in Florals?? Kind of the last place to find some hope'spiration next to Ocean Beach but I couldn't resist sitting next to a potted violet after ordering to-go.

Take a gander at their business photos: Succulents, mini-bouquets of Exotics, even Baby's Breath makes an appearance (I know because I watch a lot of Megan Batoon on YouTube). Not to mention my growing obsession for fleur tattoos on Instagram. 

***Whomever takes the time to arrange these settings: Effing Kudos and a BRAVO to you. Nothing gets past your Eye here and they're appreciated =)

For everything else, definitely little space for laptops and business chatter and I Love it. Their setup gives off a smalltown-friendly feel. If they opened late and (G forbid) were a chain, I'd bring someone as appreciative to nightcap hot coffee with.
author: Jason A.

description:
Great coffee and usually great corn muffins
Scones, please stop serving these dry bricks

But more importantly when I watch the baker in back on her cell phone for a few minutes then put it down and start to pull out some pastry dough and form it.  Yes without washing her hands!!! I am turned off.  Do you know how many germs and some other things are on cell phones!  No phones should be allowed in the kitchen

Stopped in again today and here the same girl is on her phone and making food without washing her hands!!!
author: Davis M.

description:
My first time at Andytown was in 2015, and I have been back plenty of times since! 

Andytown is best known for their drink called the Snowy Plower ($3.50), which is an iced drink with expresso, simple syrup, homemade whip cream, and....SPARKLING WATER. Weird right? It's such a strange combination that you wouldn't think it would go together, let alone like it, but trust me, it is absolutely delicious! Their whipped cream mixed into the drink gives it the creaminess and texture that makes it even more addictive! Their cheddar scones ($3) are also amazing. Fluffy, cheesy, and absolutely fresh! The aroma of their coffee and pastries as soon as you walk in is so inviting. You can definitely see and taste how locally fresh they are. In addition, the location, atmosphere, decor, and aesthetics of this place is beautiful. It's very instagram worthy, no filters needed. 

Their staff are also super nice and friendly! You will always get a warm welcome each time you come in, even when they're busy! The owners of Andytown are also there most of the time, which definitely gives Andytown a chill vibe which in turn creates a sense of community.

From their fresh food/drinks, great atmosphere and staff, you know you're getting a 5 star quality experience at Andytown. Reviews and pictures don't do Andytown any justice!
author: Oliver B.

description: Excellent, light, smooth coffee. A great place is hang out inside and outside over a nice cup of coffee.
author: James B.

description:
TL;DR Yummy unique coffee (snowy plover) + yummy food (aged cheddar)

Andy town delivers consistent quality coffee. The espressos are never burnt, and the milk is steamed perfectly. It's so so smooth. They also have unique drinks. The snowy plover is made with sparkling water, whipped cream, brown sugar and other good stuff. It tastes bitter if you don't mix it, so don't forget to fix before you drink! 

Their soda bread with the aged cheddar is also so so good. The aged cheddar was the definitely the highlight. It had the perfect bite, texture and taste. So sharp, so good.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Omg! That coffee is the best coffee ever! So smooth, no bitterness at all. And of course,  the people that work there are very nice. Will go back and tell all my friends to go as well.
I know there is a retailer over on o
9th between Irving and Lincoln.  Went there 3 times and only once did I have a good experience.  Won't go there anymore.  There's this one girl with dark hair very pale skin tone. She doesn't have any customer service at all! She's condescending and moody. It's like she doesn't want to be there. Seems she's just there for the money. Too bad. Until she's gone I won't be returning.  Also will alert my friends.
author: Reb K.

description:
MUFFINS!!! I could easily eat 3 of their cornmeal muffins by myself... in one sitting and I would love every second of it. Blueberry? Strawberry? Cheddar? Any and all, get all of them, nay... get 2 of each and thank me later. 
Anyhow, in addition to their scrumptious pastries the coffee and tea is superb as well. I love that they have a great tea selection that isn't what everyone else carries. I especially like that they have fresh ginger tea. If You like sweet things, their snowy plover is super tasty and one of a kind. I have traveled all over for coffee and they were the only place that had something like this, although a lot of coffee shops have something similar now, but they did it first and their house made whip is so good! Their latte art is always gorgeous and they have the BEST cups. I wish ceramics wasn't so expensive and I wish they sold their cups in the store. 
Ohhh. Also, for your fur parents out there. They always have dog treats and a water bowl for the pups. Plus they have a good amount of outdoor seating for our lovely fur children. They are obviously amazing because they opened up two more locations and all are equally as great. Additionally, super random, but they always have the prettiest/cutest flower arrangements. 
The only negative is their coffee bags are on the pricier end but all in all, I love this place.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Wait - 5 minutes

Value - $5 / dish.

Dish Size: Medium

Snowy Plover - I was skeptical when I was told that there's an amazing coffee drink that is a mixture of expresso, simple syrup, homemade whip cream, and sparkling water. I had to go try it myself as my mind couldn't imagine all these ingredients coming together. I was proven wrong and this cold coffee drink is amazing. 

Cheddar Scallion Scone - A must order. The scone is fresh, dense but fluffy, and most importantly cheesy. Its different than "traditional" scones in texture and flavor. The Cheddar Scallion Scone has an interesting balance between sweet and savory flavors. 

Andytown has a very cozy living room feeling. There's tchotchkes all along the walls and potted plants peppered throughout the space. The space is not large, but all the natural light reflecting off the white walls make the space feel larger than it is. Do keep in mind there isn't much seating so it's not the most ideal place if you want bring your laptop and work. 

Andytown is a great local corner shop and would be a hit in any neighborhood. I highly recommend the Snowy Plover and the fresh pastries.
author: Julian L.

description:
Andytown is the new cool hip coffee shop in the sunset. I am a big fan of the design as well as the cute to go cups. Today I decided to swing by and try to sit down and have a little breakfast inside.

- customer service is okay
- space is extremely limited
- food was really disappointing. I ordered the soda bread and for 4.50 expected it to be way bigger. I am brought over two tiny slices of plain soda bread with a side of butter. The soda bread was good but I just didn't feel like it was worth it at all. 
- latte was good, but nothing special
- overall spent 10$ on a meh cafe breakfast 

Would I come here again? If I'm in the area walking around and the line is short then sure, I'd stop by for a cup of coffee to go. But I wouldn't go out of my way for this place. It's a cute coffee shop though, I'll give it that.
author: Margaret K.

description: 9:30am Saturday a line of about ten folks that moved at a normal pace. The Buddha hand poppyseed cornbread muffin, cheddar scallion scone, and cup of coffee were excellent. The place is on the smaller side but there is indoor and outdoor seating and they have used the space well.
author: Christine Y.

description: This place is a good sign of what's to come in this neighborhood. I hate to reveal hidden gems like this, because there's already lines to this place every day. The coffee rivals the best in the city. But it's the service that sets this place apart from the rest. It's so refreshing to walk into a place where every employee sincerely cares about the details. The Snowy Plover is a unique item you must try. Their breakfast sandwich might be the best in the city and it's an example of the artisan approach to everything here. The coddled egg is a bit runny and messy, but perfectly cooked for my tastes. And that bread. Don't get me started.
author: William B.

description:
Every time I pass by Andytown, there's ALWAYS a line - no matter what day or what time. It's intriguing...especially in the Outer Sunset. 

I wanted to understand what the hype was about so I decided to finally go and order the unique and popular Snowy Plover drink, made of a blend of expresso, sparkling water, and whipped cream. Interesting mix to say the least - it tasted like a carbonated coffee warmed on a hot day. Imagine drinking from a warm water bottle left in your car! Not bad, but not good either. This drink might be an acquired taste because I was not feeling it.

The coffee shop itself is very small and cozy. There's minimal seating inside and outside, but the really great thing about this place is that it's really pet-friendly, so I often see lots of dogs outside. The shop sells different types of coffee, tea, and baked items like scones and muffins. Pretty ordinary and moderately priced. Staff were friendly and fast with our drinks - I definitely appreciate how fast the line moves. 

One tip - parking is limited in front, but you can find free parking a few blocks away near the residential areas.

Final Thoughts on the Snowy Plover:
Great as a laxative, meh as a drink. You'll feel bloated and shit fire. Cleared out my system though, so thanks lol.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Lots of neighborhood parking around this area! 

My friend recommended the snowy plover and raved about how it was the most amazing carbonated coffee. 

Cute little spot with like two tables in the front and 2-seaters alongside the cafe. 

The snowy plover is really really good. The service seemed like they could be friendlier but other than that, the line is really quick and I highly recommend the carbonated coffee! I've been telling all my friends about this spot too.
author: Melanie T.

description:
I tried this place out after a negative experience at another coffee shop nearby. I waited in line. I was greeted with an over-worked half smile. I asked if any of the pastries were vegan(for a friend).

The response?

"Uh, yea... we don't do that here"

Unbelievable! Are they trying to be like that other coffee bar with that poor attitude????

Will not return.
author: Bai B.

description:
Love  love it! Apple Pay, Irish scones, awesome coffee, and friendly happy workers....and No line today too.
I bought a latte this time :) wonderful
author: Tere C.

description:
One of my fav coffee shops in the city! They source and roast their own beans and have some unique, delicious beans from all over the world like Brazil and Equador. They're known for their snowy plover, which is good. But I'm a personal fan of old-fashioned espressos and love their cappuccinos and lattes :) they also bake their own pastries, which are also super yummy!

Seating is limited in the outer Sunset location so I would suggest going on a nice day, grabbing coffee and a scone, then walking to ocean beach :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
Found this place on Yelp, friend who is a regular told me this place was amazing for the snowy plovers and indeed she was correct! I ordered the matcha plover and my bf got the snowy plover. The plovers are made of sparking water on tap with either match concentrate or 2 shots of espresso topped with their housemade whipped cream. 

If I could order again, I would def get the snow plover because the beans they made the espresso was soooo smooth and delicious. It was perfect mixed in with the whipped cream. I'm normally not a fan of whipped cream, but it was more like a thick creama. I'll come back!
author: Micaela I.

description: Still dropping by regularly. Maybe 2 saturdays each month ... the line is a bit longer than when I started in 2016 but still worth it. Coffee and espresso drinks are just exactly right, and pastries sweet and savory are super alluring. The whole deal is mini sublime. Is that a thing? Should be.
author: Craig S.

description:
The first time I tried the Snowy Plover, which was years ago, I wasn't a coffee drinker at the time and didn't enjoy this drink too much.  In 2014, I started working in a building right across the street from a Starbucks which meant easy access to coffee.  Ever since then, I've grown to appreciate this beverage and still seek for something strong and tasty.  Fast forward to this past weekend when I revisited this drink.  Make sure you stir the ingredients together; don't be shy, give a few whirls and see the whip cream and espresso dance together as they unite as one and become happy happy ... channeling my inner Bob Ross.

This drink is super refreshing and delicious, perfect on a sunny afternoon.
author: Linda N.

description:
Andytown Coffee Roasters is a cute, very small little coffee shop out in the Outer Sunset. On any weekend morning, expect to find a line at (or out) the door - but fear not, the staff is quick with their hand-crafted hot beverages!

THE OVERVIEW.
- Seating is minimal inside, and there are 3-4 tables outside.
- Service is fast, and the line goes fast as well
- Parking is not quite non-existent, but you're most likely going to struggle to find a spot

This place is friendly for coffee and tea-lovers alike. Also kids, because their hot chocolate is bomb.
author: Claire S.

description: Best coffee in town. My favorite in the hood. Staff became less snobby recently so I love this place! Cappucino is a miracle of coffee.
author: Jonah K.

description: I love love Andytown's Snowy Plover with an extra dollop of homemade whipped cream... yummmm...
author: Cindy L.

description: My favorite coffee house in SF! Stumbled upon them 2 summers ago while in the area, and now I find myself craving their coffee drinks when I haven't had them in awhile! It's it worth waiting in line for-even when it's foggy and drizzle outside. Quick and friendly service, and the quality is evident in the flavor. I can't wait to go back in 2 weeks!
author: Gabrielle O.

description: Andytown beans is probably the best I've ever had (Stumptown being the next). I always have a bag of "Wind and Sea" coffee beans at home and my brewing method is with an Aeropress. There's always a line here on the weekends, so I try to stop by on a weekday. I believe they roast their beans twice a week, so you know you're getting fresh goods.
author: Ray Z.

description: The Irish soda bread is really tasty and authentic; iced coffee is delicious but a bit too strong.
author: Xu L.

description:
Andytown is simply the best. Excellent coffee and baked goods, beautifully designed cafe, friendly staff and good community vibes. It embodies that local, small-business feel. Their roastery on Taraval is also great and has fun pop-ups, from ice cream to a recent holiday market. 

Sunset residents are lucky to have you, Andytown.

PS: Don't miss the snowy plover and matcha latte.
author: Elena K.

description: What a fun spot.  Cheered me up on my "staycation" in the outer sunset on a foggy day.  The Snowy Plover was delightful.
author: J P.

description: This spot was recommended by a bike shop, and if anyone knows their coffee shops, it's a cyclist!  They did not steer us wrong, either.  I love how this city has matcha lattes everywhere!  This one was delicious, tasted like liquid nori.  The persimmon cornbread was wonderful, too.  We stopped here on a ride and met other cyclists, so it's very biker friendly.
author: Susie D.

description:
My favorite neighborhood coffee shop. The famous snowy plovers are excellent, but so is everything else - especially the pastries. There is good reason Andytown is exploding and opening up location after location :)
My only minor complaint is that I wish they would have more seating (in all of the locations)
author: Sid D.

description:
Interior/Parking:: 
Located on the corner on Lawton St. in San Francisco expect street parking here. There are a few seats outside for customers so great to hang out here when it is a sunny day in the City. Walking inside you see a big table that can seat quite a few people, but usually it is taken up. There are counter seating with outlets right next to each seat. I noticed that this place is quite popular for people who want to get work done. It is kind of a small place though so it feels tight sometimes. They also have a small area in the front where they sell merchandise and to be honest some of their merchandise were really cute like this beanie of a bird on it. 

Service:: 
Quick and speedy kind service here. Open to answer any questions you have and what is popular here. They accept credit cards here which is great. 

Food/Drink::
I ended up getting a latte which tasted pretty good compared to other coffee shops and that might have been because the latte didn't taste bitter like other coffee shops I've gone to. My boyfriend got the Snowy Plover which I highly recommend if you've never had coffee with soda water. Unique tasting and pretty good if you want something different.
author: Nadine Y.

description:
Such nice people there! Tried both the matcha latte and matcha plover. Loved the latte! The plover was nothing like I've ever tasted before! Not bad at all but not yet sure if I love it. I think I'll try a regular snowy plover next time. 

The soda bread with butter tasted so good. It's literally flat white bread toasted with melted butter but even though it was so simple it was so comforting. And surprisingly filling for me.

I loved the hot chocolate for its presentation and for its adult taste... more like dark chocolate, thick, creamy, not too sweet- unlike traditional hot cocoa which is more sugar than chocolate. 

The three drinks, scone, and soda bread came out to just under $20. A little much for pastries I think, but a little indulgence for a chance to sit outside on a beautiful gray Fall morning is well worth it.
author: RACHELLE T.

description:
Snowy Plover! 

The whipped cream makes this drink amazing. 
Not unusual to have a line going out the door, and there are a few seats. 
There's one big communal table in the front. 
If they have baked goods, buy em' to go with your drink, cause they good.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I had the Snowy Plow, but I like calling it Snow Plow because I can.

It's GOOD. Very GOOD. I'll even say it's GREAT. It reminds me of Crushcakes in Santa Barbara with that dollop of whipped cream afloat of an iced coffee beverage.

Think of the Snow Plow as a healthier(?)(lol), caffeinated root beer float.... yeah! Tasty!!!!

I also had a super savory butternut squash scone with goat cheese. Mhmmm. Oh yeah....

The ladies who work there slay, so their tip jar was overflowing. Work it :) 

Very cool place!
author: Michelle C.

description: From the time I got in line to receiving my items it was about 20 minutes. Not to bad for what the line looked like! I got the Snowy Plover( basically an americano with club soda?, simple syrup and homemade whipped cream) and the candied blood orange and chocolate scone. Both were different but so good! Would definitely recommend!
author: Jenette R.

description:
Highlights
- I am absolutely addicted to this coffee shop and if you haven't tried a Snowy Plover, you've got to come here ASAP! Thank goodness it's so far out that I can only treat myself when I make an excuse to venture out to the neighborhood and believe me on those days when I'm craving this, I will put in those miles into running there to "treat" myself and not feel so guilty about it after. :)
- Matcha plover is my latest discovery and it's just as delicious as my first love, their Snowy Plover. Less caffeine too per the worker. 
- The sweet corn muffins are a must order if you are already trekking out here to get the coffee. They are so delicious and hefty in size. The flavors rotate based on the seasonal fruit and I haven't been disappointed since and don't anticipate I will. Perfect amount of moist, fruit bits incorporated, and crunch from the top!
- They have limited seating inside with small tables, good for one or two people max. More tables and seats outside, but it's normally cold and packed. 

Improvements
- Seasonal Snowy Plover (?): Peppermint snowy plover topped with a mini candy cane. I didn't feel this one, tasted very much like a peppermint mocha but not as good. Stick with the original Snowy Plover or Matcha and you won't regret it. 

Tips
- Neighborhood street parking. 
- Dog friendly outdoor seating and they have a bowl of treats for dogs too!
- I tried another shop that served Andytown coffee and their plovers, but it's just not the same. Come here to try it and thank me later!
author: Tracy T.

description:
I had an almond cortado and my husband had an espresso. Both were delish!! I think next time, I'll go with just the espresso or perhaps macchiato as the coffee is good and I don't want the mylk to take away from it!

It's a small place but they do have outdoor seating, which is just so lovely on a nice day. They have a lot of 2 person small tables in doors as well. There are options!

Friendly service, and they are quick! 

I'd go back when in the neighborhood !
author: Jenna M.

description:
Small, cozy, inviting and just a gem of a coffee shop. This was our first time here and had heard about their snowy plover drink and wanted to try it. 

The place is very bright set in a family neighborhood a few blocks away from Ocean Beach. They have outdoor and indoor sitting, very pet friendly with biscuits for your dogs as treats!! 

We ordered our Snowy Plover drinks and were amazed how wonderful it tasted. Who would have thought sparkling soda water, espresso and scoops of heavy cream would translate to such  an unforgettable cold cup of coffee? A must try
author: Mehrnaz H.

description: Meh, got some wired soda coffee whip cream thing, it was not drinkable, though I liked the whip cream. The girl who was at the cashier was rude. Not much sitting available and too pricey.
author: Ramin A.

description: Great coffee shop specially the special cream they put on the coffees and anything you ask for.
author: Jay G.

description: Didn't enjoy the bird, after all the hype. it was too small of a space for us, but what can ya do. Nice customer service. Would try something else next time. We loved that whipped cream:)!
author: Katie B.

description:
Dating a coffee lover really brings you to many adorable coffee shops. Andytown coffee is where we ended up before our visit at the Golden Gate Park. It's a little further out, about 20 minutes from the city but it's worth the drive. This is a tiny coffee shop, but they use what space they have very creatively. They attach tiny wooden tables to the wall along the walkway to give customers space to sit while also utilizing their limited space...

I can't comment on the coffee because I don't do well with caffeine. 
What I can comment on is the soda bread here. Oh my gosh it is amazing. You get two slices of thick moist bread. You can ask for butter or jam, my boyfriend opted for both. The blackberry (I think??) jam complemented the bread so well with it's sweetness. The buttery-ness of the butter added the right fatty-ness. I'd drive here just for the bread lol.

Love love love this shop and can't wait to go back.
author: Yen P.

description:
Heard about the Snowy Plover so I stopped by here after a day at the Academy of Sciences.
It's a cool little coffee shop and I was able to find parking fairly easily. This was on a Saturday afternoon around 3-4PM. 

The drink itself is something I never had before. It's like an Americano with soda water instead of still. Although, I think next time I will ask for it extra sweet as I found myself adding more sugar/cream afterwards. It's definitely unique and something cool to try.
author: Lan N.

description: Snowy Plover - ugh. I am not in league with those of you who enjoy this drink. Yuck from me. Oh well, $4.50 in the can. I tried. And tried. Then tried once more. Nope. Sad
author: Janet B.

description: I got their signature drink Snowy Plover and it was a little bit too adventurous to me. It is espresso shots with sparkling water and homemade sweet whipped cream on the top. You think you are drinking soda at first, but then you realize it tasted like coffee. It was a bit weird to me. Their latte looks amazing though so I definitely want to come back and try it.
author: Andrew J.

description: I love their Snowy plover! I always get extra whipped cream. I would probably go here everyday just for Snowy plover if I lived closer.
author: Clara L.

description: The snowy plover is everything I want and need in a coffee. It's just amazing. I haven't tried anything else yet. I tried something else. It was another snowy plover and it didn't disappoint either. Love this place.
author: Tom H.

description:
I was over at Devils Teeth and had to go all out and make a stop at Andytown for their Snowy Plower ($3.50). The Snowy Plower is an iced drink with expresso, simple syrup, homemade whip cream, and wait for it.... SPARKLING WATER. Its an odd combination and one might not find appealing based on the ingredients, however, don't knock it until you give it a try. If this drink isn't to your liking, one of their coffee menu items will be up your alley. 

The staff is warm, friendly, personable - which is nice for a newbie. Check out this coffee shop when your in the neighborhood. There will most likely be a line out the door but its worth the wait.
author: Kristina S.

description:
My friend absolutely loves this place and brought me here to check it out! She highly recommended the snowy plover, so that's what I went straight for despite it being a cold and gloomy day out. 

At first I was hesitant to get it, but this drink was actually really good! It was described to me as essentially being sparkling water with espresso and whipped cream on top. Sounds odd, right? I definitely thought so! From her description, it sounded like a sparkling americano or something. But the more I sipped on it, the more I enjoyed it! The whipped cream on top isn't just your ordinary whipped cream either. It's just the right amount of sweetness and tastes amazing mixed into the drink! 

I would definitely get the snowy plover again. I've also been told the mochas here are good too!
author: Sandy Y.

description: Great coffee. Great service. Friendly workers. Aesthetic coffee shop all around. You wouldn't regret spending a dime at this place. I love everything about it. 10/10 recommend. I wish I could work here!!!
author: Zechariah O.

description:
This was interesting. Showed up at 9:15 on a Saturday and there was a bit of a line. I got the snowy plover, which was good but definitely different. I think it would be best on a rare hot SF day rather than the day I got it.

The scone was perfect. Next time I'd pass on the corn muffin. I do want to come back for a latte if I'm in the area.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Andytown is super known for their snowy plovers, sparkling water with an espresso shot and their homemade whipped cream. It's definitely a you really like it or you really don't like it type of drink when you first try it. I personally don't like it too much, but definitely at least try it!! But there are sooo many other great things you can get here. I love their iced lattes, ask for a sweetened latte if you like sweeter drinks. Their mochas are also really good and creamy. 

Food: you MUST GET the cheddar scallion scone. so. good. I also had the raspberry corn muffin today I think? That one was pretty good too! All of their pastries are really good. 

I also loooove the workers here. I don't come here often enough to know them, but whenever I come they're always so friendly and welcoming!

The place itself gives off that super hipster vibe. It's a really nice place inside and outside! The only downside is that there's not much indoor seating. There's 4-5 tables outside, and some bench seating around the front of the place, but inside is just one long bench. 

Another thing, the line is also pretty long sometimes. Around 9-10am on Sunday mornings, it's sooo crowded. I usually come after church around 1pm and the line dies down. 

There's also another location on taraval! The location is around the same size, not too big. But definitely recommend trying it out!!!
author: Patricia T.

description: Outer sunset gem. Lines prove it and the food and coffee back it up. The snowy plover is now my favorite Expresso drink. An awesome mix of sparkling water, Expresso, homemade whip cream and ice. Food is made on premise and is delightful. Be aware that Seating is limited both on the inside and out and parking can be a nightmare but hang in there because this place is worth the effort.
author: David H.

description: The baristas were very friendly ! The coffee was on point ! And the latte art was a highlight. Definitely come back when in town again
author: Theresa Y.

description: Order their amazingly crisp raspberry & blackberry corn muffin! On the outside it's crispy, but once you break into it, pockets of juicy fruit goodness are revealed. The pictures don't do its size justice - it's huge!
author: Camille E.

description: Such a cute and welcoming space; it's sits right on the corner and the lines are usually long (it goes fast though!) The menu is simple and everything is delicious. The staff members are friendly and get the orders out quickly. I really love this place and their coffees and teas!
author: Nicole A.

description:
Got their famous snowy plover (espresso, brown sugar syrup, soda water, topped with homemade whipped cream) and a cheese scallion scone for $8.25. I think this is pretty pricey, so I'm knocking a star from them.

I love sparkling water and I almost love coffee so I really enjoyed this drink! It's definitely unique and I think they pushed creativity in a favorable way. The espresso comes through strong which I appreciate and I love love love their whipped cream! It's thick and not too sweet and I found myself licking the remnants of my cup to lick up every delicious dollop! 

Cheese scallion scone was good because the outside was crisp and the inside was really soft and moist. Did not knock my socks off because I thought the cheese and scallion flavors came across as too shy

Really, really friendly service. Seating is limited

I would come back if I was in the area, but I wouldn't trek across SF or go out of my way for this place. Especially since lines are common and I waited maybe 15-20 minutes in a line out the door. It was funny because while I was in line, some disgruntled man passed by and was surprised there were so many ppl waiting, saying unashamedly "starbucks is just as good" ... not sure if I dis/asgree
author: Jeanie N.

description:
I went to high school in the outer sunset and it was always lovingly and unapologetically uncool. Definitely residential and I can't remember ever going to a coffee shop back in the day.

Andytown is definitely the answer to any question about the reaches of gentrification in SF. I always enter certain spaces in SF hoping they'll surprise me. Andytown didn't. It's just as expected. Very white. Very hip. Great coffee. Busy. Predictable aesthetic. Fancy pastries and some version of pricey toast.

So why 4 stars? I mean, this is the new San Francisco and even though I felt soooooooo uncomfortable in this space (couldn't find a person of color behind the counter...), they do what they are supposed to do well. My cafe au lait was made well and the raspberry corn muffin was Delish. Had a sort of neighborhood vibe but definitely seemed like newer people to the neighborhood and not the older residents.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Kind of blown away by how good the snowy plover is! I'd describe it as a espresso sundae. It's creamy because of the cream soda base but the whipped cream (gah the calories...) is what puts it over the top. 

Sadly I have to cave and say yeah this hipster crave is worth it... the lines moved pretty slow the day I came so don't come on a Sunday afternoon if you're short on time. 

Too little seating and the seating near the windows is horrendous if you want to get work done.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Another awesome COFFEE place in the city! It's way far from me, I'm across the city but so happy I finally got to try Andytown. Small but cute. Seats inside and out. Service was super friendly. Most importantly, the coffee is AMAZING! So good. Not bitter and overpower. One tasty cup of coffee, super yummy! 

Don't forget their baked goods. Fresh and delicious. MUST get their corn muffin, different flavor most of the time. I heard everything else is hella good too. Can't wait to go back. Wishing you will open one on the other side of waters in SF.
author: Sandy B.

description: Came from the beach and was looking for a good, nearby coffee shop, and found this one on Yelp! Cute little shop less than a mile away from Ocean Beach. I was looking through the recommendations and decided to get the Fuyu Persimmon which was so delicious! I like the crispy, crunchy top and the square slices of Persimmon inside the muffin. Snowy plover was good too! Will try the other muffins next time
author: Ro N.

description:
Holy $h!t!!!!! The coffee to end all coffee! I have found the Holy Grail! It's here, at Andytown's, in San Francisco, in the weirdest neighborhood I've ever seen! Ok, maybe Holy Grail is a little much since I haven't tasted all the coffee in the world and I hear Singapore is repping strong, but it's pretty frigging good!!!

I'm still a little baffled and lost for words. This cortado was freaking amazing! Completely and perfectly amazing! Incredible depth of flavor, incredible color, amazing texture and mouth feel and just as importantly, perfect temperature! It was a caffeinated, mouth-gasm! 

I'll put it to you this way! Having this cortado is comparable to having been with a truly amazing lover. One that came in your life, broadened your horizons, created a deep and completely immersive experience and then left you just as quickly as they came, leaving you in a deep crater of emotional baggage, slightly confused how to proceed now that you've tasted the best. Do you explore to find better or do you settle for crappy lovers, I mean coffee? 

Luckily, we can have that great coffee experience over and over again. At Andytown's! Me?! I'm going to keep searching for really good coffee and comparing it to Andytown's and a couple of other places that have given me really good coffee. But, as for advice on what to do about that elusive lover, send me a message, we'll meet at Andytown's and talk about it. Over an amazing cortado or apparently the Snowy Plover that everyone else raves about. I didn't try that; maybe tomorrow. 

Oh, and yeah, it's a small space with very few places to sit. Order your coffee, talk to the super awesome barista who is cooler than a Polar bear's toenails (Thank you Outkast) shove it down the hatch, bask in the glory of the delicious coffee rolling around your taste buds and move on with your life! You can rest when you're dead!
author: Saimir O.

description:
Absolutely love, love this place! Small cozy shop and love the atmosphere. I'm a caffeine lover and I am just so in love with this coffee shop. Using the word "love" 5 times already, I'm sure you get an idea how I have fallen head over heels.

The variety of pastries is limited but each pastry is of high quality. I ordered the Soda Currant Scone, Cheddar Scallion Scone, and Blueberry Corn Muffin. I can't pick a favorite because all of them were really, really good! 

As for coffee, the Snowy Plover is a must! This speciality drink was so unique and has changed my views of enjoying/drinking coffee. Who knew Pellegrino, espresso shots, and whipped cream together would taste amazing? I also ordered a Cafe Au Lait as well and loved it. 

Parking was not a problem for me when I went on a Saturday around 1pm. There was a line but did not wait too long. This really is a place you can't miss on your adventures to San Francisco!
author: Vivian W.

description: Great location, small stop inside but lots of seating outdoors. The staff was friendly and efficient and the drip coffee was on point (not bitter like you can often find). Lots of drink choices that all looked great
author: Shlee G.

description:
Just amazing. My friend recommended the snowy plover. It's a must try. Definitely unique tasting. 

I'm not a big coffee drinker and don't respond well to caffeine. I still would go back just to drink it. Maybe they have a decaf version. 

There was a decent line today. Plus weather was nice so not a lot of seating was available.
author: Lyman C.

description:
Had to come here to check off the snowy plover off my foodie bucket list. So what does the snowy plover consist of you ask? It is a double shot of espresso over sparkling soda with simple syrup topped off with a house made whipped cream. Yes coffee and soda does sound really weird but it does intrigue those with a brave tongue such as myself. The verdict? It was very refreshing. With that being said, however, it would not be the caffeinated drink of my choice when I am craving coffee. 

I also had the raspberry corn muffin that was filled with apricot jam. Very good cross between corn bread and a sweet fruit muffin. Not dry at all. If you do not like corn bread, you probably would not like this. 

I still have no tried all their other pastries like their scones and cookies. But, I will definitely come back soon! Parking is a breeze in the outer sunset. The sign does not say the whole name, but just a discreet "A", so be sure not to miss it.
author: Jennalyn L.

description: Went here for the first time a few days ago, and was extremely impressed. I'm typically more into a darker roast, but was very impressed with the medium roast that they were serving; super smooth and flavorful!  They do a terrific job at roasting their own beans, and the folks working there were super nice and friendly.
author: Lawrence P. W.

description: Snowy plover. Espresso shots with sparkling water topped with homemade whipped cream. First sip, the carbonation surprised me. Taste-wise, it's like a coffee soda. Interesting taste but addicting.
author: Marti L.

description:
This place is always packed but their coffee is worth the wait.

Strongly recommend their drip coffee.  It's simply amazing!

Will try their snowy plovers next time as many reviewers rave about this.

Worth the time, effort to come for nice coffee and baked goods.
author: William W.

description:
Andytown is a sign of the gentrification of the Outer Sunset. Not a bad thing because these sort of hipster cafes know their coffee and pastries.

Expect a line out the door. Thankfully they hire enough baristas to keep the line moving. The place is fairly narrow and has very limited seating inside. Not the sort of cafe you can relax and enjoy your coffee for long stretches of time especially if it's the weekend. You'll most definitely be eyeballed by other customers wondering when you are going to leave. We got supremely lucky timing wise with table seating but tried to gobble down the muffin pronto so others could sit. 

Latte - Milky. Lacked a strong espresso flavor profile that I get from a Ritual latte (what remains to be my fav latte in the city).

Persimmon, cornmeal, and goat cheese muffin - Solid. The cornmeal added a nice texture and there were chunks of persimmon in it that you really couldn't taste but to be expected as permission doesn't impart the strongest flavor. Appreciated the seasonality of the muffin and the goat cheese was a nice touch.

All the pastries looked delectable though that it made it tough to pick just one.

Apparently I left here without trying their specialty soda bread and signature drink, the snowy plover. Will definitely be back for both. Also some important 411: this place serves bacon!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
There was already a line out the door when I stopped by around 8 on a Saturday. Of course people in SF are early risers, so I wasn't surprised but it's always a good sign when there's a line. 

I tried their snowy plover, mocha and a cheddar jalapeño muffin. I was hesitant about the plover because it sounded so weird, but I really wanted to try it. It's just like others describe it, a carbonated coffee, similar to a coffee soda. It wasn't my thing, but I really liked the mocha.  Super smooth and creamy, like drinking a dark chocolate bar. My favorite thing was the cheddar jalapeño muffin. It was ahhhmmazzing!! Spicy, moist and packed with flavor. We almost came back the next day to grab another one but didn't have time. Do yourself a flavor and get one if you're here.
author: Vy T.

description: Excellent from top to bottom. Beautiful pastries and breads, finely roasted and brewed coffee, and a really pleasant eat in or sit outside experience in the amazing west end of SF. Bravo Andytown!
author: Rob W.

description:
Solid as always - the snowy plover is so unique...made with espresso,
pelligrino, and a dollop of whipped cream. Comes out like a coffee flavored soda.  Very refreshing and leaves no bitter or acidic aftertaste. I've had the scones but would like to try some of the breads and spreads. They are served on wooden boards in a rustic fashion. Not much seating but love the communal table right  in the front. Take it to go and walk on the beach!
author: jennifer m.

description:
Snowy plover? Whoops. Apparently I chose wrong. I just got a hot chocolate, and split a blueberry muffin and a Cheddar and chive scone. 

Thankfully, I got here before the line was twenty people out the door... I wouldn't have waited, but people did not seem concerned. Maybe it's a cult following. 

Hot chocolate? Perfect. Whipped cream? Oh dear got I want to start off every day right with their deliciously thick and sweetened whipped cream. Maybe it wasn't sweetened; just flavored... Not sure. But... You want it. On a mocha. In your coffee. Placed with a spoon on your tongue while you drool because, yes, it's that good. 

I paid 14 for two hot chocolates, the muffin and the scone--greatness. I recommend the scone over the muffin, that's for sure. The blueberry muffin was a blueberry muffin... And made more interesting because it was made corn meal and had chunky sugar in top (yep, I had nothing to complain about there). Other than that, it was just a blueberry muffin, and the ones I make at home are just as good. 

So next time, snowy plover. And then, for goodness sake, a shot of whipped cream.

UPDATE: went back for the snowy plover. A shot of espresso over iced fizzy water, then whipped cream. I was skeptical; I made a face...  And so will you. But try it anyway. Because, like others said, in some, strange way... It really does work.
author: Tina S.

description:
This place seemed to quite a popular cafe for locals, so I decided I should try it out one weekday afternoon. To my surprise, it was super packed! I would've thought more people would be working but there were a lot of people just lounging around here even though there are barely any seats. For such a popular place, the venue here is quite small with only a few barstool tables and one communal table inside. The outside has a few more tables for you to enjoy your food and drink. I think they should consider expanding their cafe since it's so popular!

The staff here was very pleasant and friendly. I saw that they were very well known for the Snowy Plover but then I found out it was made with Pellegrino soda water, which I am not a very big fan of. Consequently, I expressed my concerns to the cashier and she offered to make one for me and she would make me something else if it didn't suit my taste buds. Unfortunately, I really hated the Snowy Plover and asked for a new drink. I'm so glad she made me a new mocha, which was really really nice of her and it was great coffee.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Generally, when Yelpers give a shop 5 stars it's really good. I have to disagree on this one. First of all drip coffee is a thing of the past. Gas stations have it. 7-11 does it. But they are not coffee roasters. I guess I just assumed that a shop roasting coffee in a 325 sq ft shop would brew coffee the right way. The drip coffee was clearly old and the taste was awful! Burnt and flavorless. Soda bread was crunchy and lacked flavor. Pretty much a waste of time and money on my part. 

I wanna get behind small business and support locally operated coffee shops. But I can't ever see myself returning here for stale drip coffee.
author: Hector G.

description: Hipster SF coffee at its finest - the shop is small with minimalist, clean decor and lovely light wooden tables. Big windows let in a lot of sun. I've had both the  Snowy Plover and just a normal cappuccino. I love the Snowy Plover because it's definitely unique and tastes like a coffee float with rich cream. Super refreshing and unique. The cappuccino was also delicious and came in a very lovely mug. There are also scones and soda bread available that look pretty tasty as well. Definitely would come back if I'm in the area!
author: Hali M.

description:
I finally caved and came here for coffee. Thank god I came during and off hour. I'll admit. I paid an absurd amount for a cup of cold crew ice coffee and damnit, it was good. You know it's a cup of good coffee when you're not a black coffee drinking and you have this baby black. 

Would I wait forever in the morning for their joe, probably not. Are there other places with slightly better prices for and equally good cup of joes? Absolutely. But, we live in San Francisco and unfortunately as our city becomes more gentrified and the prices for quality coffee will continue to increase.
author: Diane T.

description: Snowy plover all day -- up all night.  Yes, it is sweet, it is rich, it is profoundly caffeinated, and, for some reason, it has bubbles.  No need to explain -- just get in my mouth.
author: Olivia W.

description:
Omg where have I been?!  Just had Andytown for the first time and I'm LOVING IT!  Snowy Plover I  you.  
Dang this is really good.
author: hannah t.

description: Living a few blocks away from this place must be one of the best perks of coming back home from college. THE best coffee I've ever had. Great people working there and everything I've tried is delicious. Oh and the whipped cream? Best you'll ever try! Definitely recommend.
author: Alec B.

description:
Hipster cafes epitomize my love-hate relationship with SF: I am fond of the whimsically creative culture, but I am not too fond of the prices (though sometimes the ridiculousness of the prices is amusing in itself). 

Andytown is quite the quintessential hipster SF cafe, covering everything from succulents and fresh flowers to $4 toast served on wooden charcuterie boards. The artsy vibe looks straight out of Pinterest, with lots of wood and an airy feel from the tall ceilings. Props to a clean bathroom, which is artsy as well. 

I find it an energizing environment that's decent for getting work done. The side tables against the wall can hardly fit your laptop and a cup of coffee, but the communal table is spacious. (The only catch is getting hungry staring at the delicious pastries, but realizing $7 pie pockets are not within your budget)

Snowy plover $4 || Andytown's specialty soda with coffee, topped with house-made cream. Yes, soda with coffee sounds questionable, and it's exactly how it turns out--strange at first, but you it grows on you. It's a bit of an acquired taste type of drink, but whipped cream always makes it tasty at the end of the day. I would recommend if you would like to cross this off your foodie bucket list, but I wouldn't be craving soda coffee per se.

Cappuccino $3.50 || Woaw, you can tell from their espresso drinks that their coffee beans are of superb quality. On weekends, you might even see them roasting beans in the back. My main complaint is that there was no latte art on the cappucino.

Wheat soda bread with butter $4 || The obligatory $4 toast, now considered an SF norm. Pricey considering any other spreads are a hefty extra charge ($2.75 for the addition of ham cheddar and bacon... can probably get you an entire breakfast sando at most normal places) I'm usually not a fan of soda bread, but I did enjoy this because it tasted so fresh and hearty with the whole wheat composition.

Strawberry corn muffin $3.25 || Cruffins and cronuts are everywhere, but why don't I ever see a corn bread muffin? This was rather ingenious, because the shape of the muffin (and extra wide muffin top!) allowed for corn bread with an extra crunch. The filling of strawberry jam paired very well, not in an odd sweet-and-savory kind of way, but in a natural muffinness/dessertness. Wonderfully clever flavors and textures.

Jalapeno cheddar corn muffin $4 || Mmm, the savory, more provocative cousin of the fruit corn muffin. Excellent kick with the jalapeno and burnt cheddar.

Overall, Andytown Coffee Roasters is a unique cafe worth checking out, and it's much more friendly than Trouble with their troublesome mannerisms. The space is a neat place to chill, enjoy good coffee and risqué pastries, and feel San Franciscan.
author: Edna C.

description: Snowy plover is now one of my favorite drinks! I asked for it to be extra sweet since i usually order things to be on the sweeter side. The huckleberry plover is also good but i also ordered it extra sweet. Both drinks normally come a little bit sweetened, iced, big scoop of cream, and the soda water. Genuinely exceeded my expectations. They are geniuses for taking coffee to the next level.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Came here for some iced coffee because San Francisco was having one of those rare sunny days and I needed something to cool down.

I heard great things about the Snowy Plover but I absentmindedly ordered an iced coffee instead. But I was not disappointing, it was strong but in a good way even before added cream and sugar.
