And once you've tried their cheddar & scallion/jalapeño scone or blueberry corn muffin you'll be hooked, guaranteed. They're usually fresh out of the oven, HOT + HEAVENLY. 

I'd spend hours at this place almost every weekend. Though they don't have a ton of seating, I always manage to find a spot. Regulars/neighbors are friendly. Adorable dogs. What more can you ask for?

Love these guys. Go.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Found this coffee shop on Yelp on our way up to Land's End. 

My friend ordered a cappucino. She was asked did she want it in a larger cup (larger than the 8 oz). She said yes. She was then given a latte. When piping up that she ordered a cappucino, she was told, "It's the same thing, just one has more milk! :)" 

WTF kind of responses is this? They aren't the same thing. 

Overall just OK coffee, but in a city of this much coffee, they aren't a must for me.
author: Sam C.

description:
Andytown Coffee roasts their own coffee in house. it's a small place. some seating.
available. Andytown can be found by looking for the building on the corner with a large "A" hanging in front of it's entrance.

brew: drip coffee(2.25)
-bold, smooth, easy sipping
-fab price, better than the big name places.

drips:
-scones seem the rage here
-not being a scone fan, i passed.
author: Victor G.

description:
This place is awesome! 

I tried their signature Snowy Plover, which is an iced drink consisting of sparkling water, espresso, simple syrup, and house whipped cream. So unique and delicious. It was sweet yet a little sour from the espresso soda water and their whipped cream is amazing! I mixed it into my drink to make it creamier, but I was tempted to just eat it with a spoon haha. I also bought a strawberry corn muffin for $3 - so worth it. It was a pretty large muffin - we ate it throughout the whole day. It was perfectly dense and sweet like cornbread and had real strawberries baked into it. So good! My bf tried their drip coffee and he liked that too. We're both fans and will definitely be back!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Perfect for coffee lovers! Simple selection of coffees and excellent scones! They have the usual coffee, macchiato, cappuchino, latte, espresso, etc. But they have one thing that sticks out like the other : Snowy Plower! Try that if you haven't!

Black Coffee: When I try out new coffee places, I usually get the black coffee because I want to see how their coffee tastes without all the added milk and sugar. This coffee is pretty good! Not too tangy and not too bitter or deep. It's good!

Latte: My bf loved it and said it was the best latte he's ever drank. Best latte art I've ever seen. So beautiful!

Blueberry Peach Scone: warm and delicious! tastes like a corn muffin

Not too many seating inside, but it is well lighted and clean! Definitely coming back! I love it.
author: Carmen C.

description: My usual Sunday morning spot before my workout. Coffee is great but sometimes it is little too acidic for me. So far I like their scone, moist and tasty. Not a big fan of their corn muffin with berry jam. Jam is too bitter and the corn muffin itself is little too bland.
author: Jade P.

description:
Andytown is a haven in the desert! Nice respectable coffee. 4 star due to lack of food options, especially savory ones. 

Long lines because one of the few good coffee places in sunset!
author: Rahul V.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS NEWEST ADDITION TO OUTER SUNSET!

They've only been open a few weeks and there's already a line out the door! 

Order:
- drip coffee
- snowy plover (coffee, house whip, soda water)
- season corn muffin w/ strawberries (gluten free)

Everything was delish, but the SNOWY PLOVER is my new all time favorite cofffee. 

Can't wait to go back and try their soda bread with cheese and bacon :)
author: Kristen C.

description: My boyfriend and I came here after we put our name down at Outerlands for brunch.  I had heard the scones here were spectacular, but the muffins were calling my name.  The girl who helped us was so friendly and happy to be working there.  She noted that the strawberry corn muffins were still warm, which sealed the deal.  The muffin was indeed warm and freshly baked, crusty on the outside and moist on the inside - aided by fresh cut strawberries in the dough.  The atmosphere here was clean and modern, but there is limited seating and it is a small space.  The snowy plover was BEST THING EVER - espresso, San Pellegrino, fresh whipped cream.  It was everything I had hoped it would be and just slightly sweet (take it from a frappuccino-lover like me... there is no need to add sugar as it is perfect as is, especially when you mix in the whipped cream).  God, I hope Andytown franchises out into the Mission so I can go everyday.  Really loved this place.
author: Christina G.

description:
That long line out the door is there because they're slow as hell. If you see that line, be ready for 15 minutes or more of waiting around and hearing the cashiers chit chat about nothing and move around without any urgency. (e.g Bearded dude blathering on about his favorite t shirt company)

Other cafés have long lines too, but they move, with more consideration for people's time. 

Coffee is good, people are nice, but so so so slow and frustrating.
author: Kenya F.

description:
Great atmosphere, delicious food, and, most importantly, fantastic coffee. The shop is bright, clean, and simple, which makes it feel airy, even though it's a long and narrow space. There's a communal table in the front, small wall tables along the side (each with a plug below it), and outdoor seating in front of the shop.

The coffee menu has the usual lattes and drip coffee, and unique options, like the Snowy Plover (espresso cream soda). There's also non-coffee choices, such as hot cocoa and tea.

The food menu includes soda bread, scones, sausage rolls (highly recommended) and cookies.

The Sunset is lucky to have a coffee roaster, and a cafe that doesn't have the pretension of other coffee places in SF.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Congratulations to Andytown on their opening! Can't wait to finish writing my thesis here  

The interior of this spot is absolutely gorgeous. Welcoming and bright, with a large communal table made with refinished wood, this spot practically begs you to talk to the super friendly and gorgeous owners while they make your cup of coffee. 

Speaking of coffee, the coffee is like another reviewer said, on par with Ritual and Four Barrel. Andytown is a serious new contender on the San Francisco coffee scene, and I can't wait to see how they grow and expand. 

The coffee I ordered was the Snowy Plover, sparkling soda with simple syrup, a shot of espresso and fresh whipping cream. At first the taste leaves you a little confused, but in the best way possible. It's like a Guinness with cream and without alcohol. Without a doubt, my number one recommendation. 

Anddddd they have wifi! Now I don't have to leave the outer sunset ever when I'm craving good coffee. (*^^*)
author: Monique K.

description:
Andytown Roasters is my favorite coffee shop near Ocean Beach. I usually bike there through Golden Gate Park and stay a while to read on a Saturday afternoon.

The homemade muffins and scones are delicious, often still warm from the oven. Get there early before they run out. All drinks are equally tasty, and are served by friendly staff. 

Five stars for Andytown, a pleasant experience every time.
author: Brian H.

description:
Nearly a year after Andytown opened i finially made a point to stop in one day after picking my son up from school to try the Snowy Plover I'd heard so much about.  Made with Pelligrino, a brown sugar syrup, 2 shots of espresso over ice and topped with a generous serving of house made whipped cream It reminded me of a float made with coffee ice cream so the "coffee float" descriptions are not far off.  The Plover is bes,t in my opinion, when you can really mix up the whipped cream into the drink - i found the tastiest plover I had was the one i poured into a bigger tumbler that allowed me more room to mix the drink up without splashing over.

the rest of the menu is minimal, but very good!  Aside from the standard coffee/espresso drinks, Andytown offers a selection of soda bread scones (savory/sweet) and cookies.

the menu itself is so minimalist as to almost be missed if you are short: its a stark white (to match the walls) in an austere sans serif font.

minimal seating inside at 3-4 small tables that seat 2, or folding cafe tables outside.  If you're lucky you will get a seat at the big square indoor table....that is, unless some technodouche had claimed the whole damn thing.

I will make a point of visiting every week for my snowy plover though!
author: stephanie e.

description: Love their Snowy Plover drink!  Bear a short wait in line for this delicious and refreshing coffee beverage.  They have decent options for breakfast / snack - scones, muffins, etc.
author: Meredith K.

description:
Great coffee and pastries, the staff here is always friendly and helpful.

Space is small inside but there are tables outside to sit.
author: V U.

description: There is a bit of a line, but well worth the wait. Get the snowy plover. It sounds oddly enticing, and you will not be disappointed!
author: Beth B.

description:
The staff is very friendly and accommodating, even for complicated orders. While the place is small, the window seat is a nice place to enjoy your drink/food and meet people. I definitely plan to go again!

The difficulty with the seating, however, is that it's hard to get out of your seat to go to the washroom or pick up your order if the line is long.
author: David L.

description:
I've been here many times and Andytown never disappoint me.  Very friendly staffs!

I really love their muffins and scones.  My favorite is the strawberry corn muffin!
Came here for the Snowy Plover on a hot day and it was really refreshing.  
Also tried their mocha, latte and cappuccino.  
The plus is that they have almond milk!
author: Kei C.

description: Heard about this great coffee shop from a dear friend and was glad I was in the neighborhood on my day trip in SF. As a first-timer I ordered the Snowy Plover and this drink absolutely blew my mind! The combination of the sparkling water, espresso and homemade whipped cream was such a treat... and not bad for being $4. I didn't have much of a line, but it would be worth it even if there was one. Hope they open shop in LA (like all the other coffee places have done)!
author: Jinny H.

description:
WOWOOWOWOWOWOWW. EVERYTHING IS SOOOO DELIGHTFUL TO THE TASTE BUDS. The scones aren't drop dead amazing, but they're pretty yummy! The espresso was packed full of flavor as was the drip coffee! AND AND AND, TO TOP IT OFF, THE SNOWY PLOVER WAS WHAT THE FREAK WOWZERZ CRAZY YUMMMZ. Who woulda thought to mix sparkling water with espresso and homemade whipped cream?! YUMYUM. Perfect drink for the summer.. or well, any season really. 

Would drive from SJ to SF for this coffee ANYDAY.. if I had time! 

ALSO! ALSO! The store is decorated really cutely, and the staff were friendly friendly which is a plus plus!
author: Kim N.

description:
The coffee at Andytown is equal to 4 barrel or ritual coffee. Andytown has the added benefit of an oven and fresh baked goods. 
It is worth the drive (or walk) to try Andytown.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Has the makings of a neighborhood hub.

Space - visually 5 stars. Comfortwise - 3 Only one - strangely big table which is cool looking but not conducive to comfortably seating. 

Exterior - I overheard one of the owners talking about expanding the outdoor sitting area but at the moment its super small.

Baked goods - 5 stars for the scones. Not a fan of scones in general so believe me when i say that this scone alone makes this place a destination.

Coffee - 1.5 stars for the drip.  Super acidic, turning sour within 25 minutes. If i didnt know any better i'd a thought i was drinking stale applejuice.
author: Oleg H.

description: Great espresso (smooth!) and delicious soda current scones! Also, I love the high small tables, perfect for a bit of contemplation!
author: Erin W.

description: "SNOWY PLOVER! " My friend, Lyndon, brought me one to try & I shared some with my friend, "Maria" First time to drink it & now I'm totally Hooked.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Fresh out of the oven pastries are heavenly. Friendly servers. Inside / outside seating. Great way to start any day.
author: David C.

description: Love their almondmilk Lyons Tea Au Lait and gluten free muffins! Andytown is a staple whenever my friends and family come to town. The only downside is that there can be a wait!
author: Aimee W.

description: The snowy plover is not the best coffee drink I've had, not the most interesting I've ever had, but it still might be my favorite coffee I've ever had.  That whipped cream is awesome!
author: Michael D.

description:
This place has been a fantastic addition to the Sunset. It offers the best espresso drinks west of 19th avenue.  I often walk miles to go here, and am usually greeted by a line around the corner.  It is worth it!

Pretty color scheme and good use of wood in terms of the style.  The Andytown "A" sign is also tres beau. 

Snowy plover is nice, but don't eat it in the shade on a cold day.  Brrr!

Good seating options.  Inside there are mini tables and outside there are full tables.  Plus there are a couple of benches on the Lawton Street side. 

I liked the cafe that used to be here (Kalia's Coffee Corner/Buzz), but Andytown has actualized the corner's potential much more than the former cafe did.  It has become a good mix of traditional populist Irish Catholic SF, hipster, and yuppie techie. 

This cafe seems to have led to a nice renaissance on this block with a couple of likeminded neighbor businesses.  It bridges the gap between the Judah Trouble Coffee corridor and the Noriega Establish corridor. 

The regular coffee is good too.  Loved their cranberry scone as well. 

I don't think I ever got my free scone that I was entitled to for being one of the original Andytown crowdfunder donors though.  :-P
author: Joseph B.

description: barista from this place makes coffee very quick, but incredibly good. Latte from this place was amazingly great lol. Line was pretty long but it was WORTH the wait.
author: Jay K.

description:
Hipster coffee spot
Delicious drinks and homemade pastries
Get the snowy plover, espresso, pellagrino, brown sugar, coffee cream..= delicious!! 

A bit coffeeish, a bit fizzy like a soda, a bit creamy like a float....totally yummolocious. 

For 3.75 can't go wrong.

Will be back 4 sure.
author: Petri Y.

description:
Delicious coffee/expresso every single time. I've had regular coffee, lattes, and snowy plovers. They're all good. Also, I must mention the savory scones... I don't even like scones, but these are so good that I always end up ordering one. They're super fresh, full of flavor, but not the generic overpowering kind of flavor. If you're lucky enough, you might even get one that's still hot from the oven. 

I'm so glad there's a place like this in my neighborhood!
author: Gloria B.

description:
Snowy plovers, scones, and the farl soda bread with bacon/cheddar is all to die for. I wish I had pictures, but somehow I seem to scarf everything down here before it even comes to mind. 

ALSO their dinosaur mugs are the cutest.
author: Christine K.

description:
how did I just come across this place?! best coffee spot in the sunset y'all! It's a cute little hipster shop which is my kind of vibe. I had my shiba with me that day and was told I couldn't have him inside (even though there was a sign on the door that I missed.. OOPS!), but they have outdoor seating so GOOD save andytown!

Ordered their infamous snowy plover which was... different. It's a concoction of coffee with pellegrino and their homemade whipped cream which was the only thing I really enjoyed from this drink. I'll stick to my usual soy lattes which they have nailed! Yes! perfect foamy consistency for me and a 10/10 for taste and art :) you'll find me as a regular at this place for sure!
author: Crystal L.

description:
Must try when you are in the outer sunset area.

Latte - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars
Wait - 5 stars ( 4 ppl in front of me at 830am)

Parking is tricky especially with the construction materials company across the street.

I was told I have to try the special next time... snowy Plover!

I'll be back to try your scones too.
author: JC C.

description:
Okay let's just get this straight first: my absolute favorite coffee shop in all of San Francisco.

Given, Andytown is very close to my house, that does not sway my opinion at all. I would drive halfway across the city for this coffee. I consider myself fairly versed in espresso quality and have had almost all of their drinks. There is nothing bad I could say about any of them. But of course my favorite is their snowy plover which you absolutely must try. 

And as if their coffee didn't impress you, ALL of their baked goods are ridiculous. Like I didn't know soda bread could taste so good. And their muffins and scones are just to die for.

And so with delicious food and drinks and adorable decor I figured I wouldn't care if the service was bad or good. But somehow they managed to find the sweetest people to run this store. I literally went in to ask for a cup of water and despite their long line they still were very attentive and even bothered to ask how my day was. I don't think I've been to a coffee shop in San Francisco in which the cashier was so nice especially since I wasn't even ordering anything!

And so I don't usually post reviews about coffee shops as I don't typically feel so opinionated about them. But I just love Andytown so much I had to let the world know. Give it a try and maybe you'll love this place just as much as I do.
author: Megan W.

description:
Snowy Plover a bird that this espresso drink is named after. 
Probably because of the fluffy plop of whipped cream, resting on top of iced S. Pellegrino, two shots of espresso and some sweetness. 
Mix that whipped cream all up into the drink and you'll be very happy. 
It's so good. I think I'll go back tomorrow. 
The soda bread, also very good.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Awesome coffee in a quiet neighborhood in the sunset.  tiny store front with cool seatings and outside tables.  they roast their own beans.  good coffee and snowy plover (sparkling water + espresso with dollop of whipped cream).  their corn muffins and scones are bomb as well!!

i love this new cafe!  i might just go there daily if i had the chance!
author: Linda T.

description:
Hip little joint to grab a coffee. Very small selection of drinks to choose from, which means that they'll pump out consistently proper drinks. The place can get busy sometimes, but the wait isn't bad at all. The baristas behind the counter are helpful and can serve up a mean cup of coffee, but the Snowy Plover is why you want to swing by for a visit. 

- Snowy Plover - Pretty cool concept and not a bad way to get your dose of caffeine. Grab one if you need to shake up your coffee routine, you may end up replacing your daily coffee w these - they're pretty good. 

Note: The cream is made in-house, go nuts and get a double dollop. 

They also have scones and muffins, if you wanted something to go w your drink. You can usually get in and out pretty quickly. The space is pretty limited, but it can be a decent place to catch up w a friend or even get some work done, if need be.
author: Jaso N.

description: This place is amazing.  We didn't expect good coffee here so surprised when we found the place in a corner of a quiet street and there is a good ocean view    Their bread is fresh and tastes great.  I ordered snowy polxxx. It is so good.  I never had this coffee in other places.  Simple menu but unique   Also the store has wonderful decoration
author: Dong Z.

description:
What a unique coffee mix! I ordered the Snowy Plower with extra whip! It's a shot of expresso with sparkling water and a spoonful of their special whip cream! $4 drink! The drink menu is very limited, which is okay because it seems like everyone is there for their Snowy Plower anyways. 

It's totally hipster vibe and hidden inside sunset district. 

The service is great! It's a very youthful vibe so everyone is extra jubilant while working. I would definitely come here again on a nice sunny San Francisco day! It's also conveniently close to the beach, so take it to-go and walk along the beach if ya like!!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
One of the best coffee shops I've ever had the opportunity to go to. And I'm a coffee LOVER. If you are lucky enough to drop in the Snowy Plover is a must! It's kinda like a coffee float with homemade fresh whip cream!  YUM! 
 The staff is so friendly! If you're walking your doggy then they got something yummy for your four legged friend as well. 
The place is impeccably clean! You can smell the scones baking and the coffee brewing. This place is a must!
author: Claudia C.

description:
This place is totally amazing. Definitely the best coffee in the sunset, if not the whole city!

I love coming here on a Saturday morning and the line never bothers me. The long line is just true testament of how good this place is!

Snowy plover is worth a try, the homemade whipped cream is addictive! I was wondering had Michael and Lauren ever though about introducing a nitrogen brew?

Apart from the amazing coffee, the soda bread is a real seller for me. It's exactly how my grandmother made it and how my mom still makes it! And it is so hard to get proper 'northern Irish' soda bread in this city. 

Andytown is edgy, unique and ahead of the game in what it offers all round! Keep up the great work!
author: Aoibheann M.

description: Scone was yummy! (Omg, and now just got a whiff of freshly baked ones...mmmm) Had a nice crunch on the outside. The latte was also very decent, but it looks like the snowy plover (iced coffee with house whipped cream I think?) Is their signature drink here. The most noteworthy had to be the staff; they're so friendly! And in a genuine-happy way. I was sitting there for a bit and this grumpy man came in and wasn't what I would consider  to be polite, but the staff member kept up her good nature. Kudos to her!
author: Loretta C.

description: Smalling coffee shop with a big heart. Coffee us amazing, ambience is great,  and their barista's are true artists.  Coming from la, this is my new official coffee shop
author: Josh C.

description:
Andytown beats Devil's Teeth for Sunset coffee shop/bakery amazingness.

All their coffee drinks are stellar and their baked goods are so consistently amazing. 

DT seems to be pretty inconsistent from my own experience. The breakfast sandwich is good, but the muffins are awful (they were like dense rocks - could have used it as a door stop). The carrot cake is amazing. Maybe they try to do too much.

Andytown is just amazing all around. The espresso drinks are perfectly creamy, the corn muffins and the scones are baked right on the counter. Sausage rolls are amazing, but too greasy for every day consumption. Though I can see why everyone loves them so much! They do a few things and do them really, really well--a tried and true biz philosophy that aligns perfectly to Andytown's success.

10 stars for Andytown.
author: Steph M.

description:
Pretty decent coffee. I don't think the coffee here is anything special. The pastries here are pretty good. I come here whenever I meet someone in the Sunset for some coffee.

Its a small place and they managed to get a lot done with the space they have. If you are in the neighborhood its really nice place to get a cup of coffee and walk couple blocks down to the beach and enjoy the outdoors for a bit.
author: Moses L.

description:
Pretty average hipster coffee shop.  I ordered a drip coffee, only to find it was brewed in batch and held in a thermal dispenser as opposed to manually poured over like Blue Bottle.  The coffee was a solid medium roast, with a few fruity and acidic notes but lacked body.

I tried my friend's Snowy Plover.  All I tasted was the sparkling water.  I mixed it and tried it again, but I still didn't really get the appeal.  If I'm looking for coffee in the area, I might come back.
author: Patrick M.

description: Andytown was the perfect find during our recent stay in the outer sunset. Our AirBNB host mentioned Andytown as the local coffee shop and we knew we had to get over and check it out. Sadly, we waited until our last day to make our first visit. We definitely could have enjoyed our share of snowy plovers during the week. Super cool shop, super cool staff, amazing baked goods. So happy we found Andytown and look forward to checking it out again during our next trip!
author: Kristi N.

description: I hate sour coffee, like blue bottle coffe. I had to ask the lady if it's sour, she gave me a taste and it was good. I kept reading about the snowy plover on yelp so I got one. Damn that was a lot of whip cream they put in it but it was delicious! I would definitely get it as a treat again! I also got a chocolate cherry scone, I mean how can that taste nasty? It was good, not dry, flavorful buttery chocolatey.
author: Karen T.

description:
I rarely make a face like i just ate a lemon unless it was an actual lemon.  I got a coffee and i made that lemon face. I'm choking it down because i paid $2.50 for this tiny cup but will not return. 

Place looks nice. A hipster's paradise
author: Don C.

description:
Stunningly beautiful little cafe.

Good coffee and nice people.

The sausage rolls are incredible.
author: G K.

description: He snowyplovers are so good I haven't even tried the rest of the menu. Very very tasty. Really cute ambiance inside too! Definitely a good addition to the neighborhood!
author: Jael L.

description: They ARE OPEN MONDAYS! as always awesome baked goods perfect coffee plover is a must! Can't love this little place more so happy it's in my neighborhood !!
author: Nena L.

description:
This has to be my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco, hands down, let's just take a moment and give them a round of applause.

Okay - done? Cool.

In the beginning, I was hesitant about ordering the snowy plover, but what the heck - I like strange combos. I will say, it's an acquired taste and it takes some getting used to, but once you try it, you'll want it again and again, no matter what the weather! 

The crew always seems so nice and their setup is quick and efficient. Although there is limited seating, there is the beach nearby!

Thank you for extending your business hours until 5pm and finally opening on Mondays! I'm excited!

Andytown is also the only coffee shop that I ever feel like I want to give a tip to - and so, that says a lot!
author: Tammy S.

description: omg my best friend brought me here cause she loves the Snowy Plover and she made me try hers and it was SO WEIRD! Not a big fan of carbonated espresso, LOVE the whipped cream though. Anyway, I came here again recently cause I wanted coffee and I live close by. I ordered a latte with almond milk and requested it to be "not too hot" and OMG IT WAS AMAZING! This is the BEST "hot" coffee I've ever had, EVER! It was very slightly sweet from the almond milk but not too bitter, just the way I like my coffee. Usually it's either too sweet or too bitter and I have to add sugar but then I feel bad for adding sugar. But yeah, PERFECT HOT ALMOND LATTE. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: If you're only going to remember two things before going to Andytown, know this: Get the strawberry corn muffin and a coffee. I'm not a huge espresso drinker anymore, and prefer my coffee black, so while the Snowy Plover sounds good, it's not really my thing.  But that shouldn't stop you either.  In any case I am definitely a sweets person and that strawberry corn muffin was calling my name the minute I laid eyes on it.  In sitting and enjoying my food and beverage, space is definitely limited here, but the one thing I absolutely appreciated about Andytown was how many people call themselves a regular here.  The people behind the counter greeted each of their regular customers like old friends.  Nothing overly pretentious here, and definitely an environment that welcomes relaxers, families, or people stopping in for a breakfast item and coffee.  I wish I could come here more often! The coffee was good, although I think our coffees were served a little too hot which made tasting it a little difficult. That being said, this is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Lisa I.

description: Have to give props to Nena L. for the tip on the Snowy Plover. It was everything that it was described as being, delicious, somewhat sweet and sour at the same time, etc. I got two so I would have something to drink while walking to the beach. I love the location not being too far from the N-line. The place itself is cramped but the line moved a lot quicker than I would have thought. The staff was polite and efficient so i will have no problems heading out west to this place next time I'm in the city.
author: James R.

description:
I think I'm sinning when I tell people I don't like the Snowy Plover. Don't get me wrong, I love coffee and I crave it when I don't get my daily intake. But personally, I like my espresso free of bubbles. (Snowy Plover = 2 shots espresso + Pellegrino + brown sugar + homemade whipped cream)

Putting that aside, I love their lattes. They're not the strongest, but they taste very well balanced. I don't have to add a single thing to it and it'll keep me going for a couple of hours.

Appreciate the outdoor seating, but it's still a challenge finding a spot. I only come here to meet up friends - not a place to study because of its size. A quick walk to the beach is always pleasant when Karl (the fog) isn't out. 

Make sure to check the opening hours, as they are limited. No minimum on card that I am aware of.
author: Ashley L.

description: Yum! Yum! Yum!  Thank goodness the guy in front of me ordered the Snowy Plover - I probably wouldnt have tried based on name alone, but it looked to SO delicious and it was. I had to stop myself from ordering a pastry but I wil be back for one - perhaps after a nice long run in GGP beause balance makes life go 'round. These guys roast their beans in house 3 times per week and my espresso almost tasted like a chocolate covered almond.
author: Aubrey O.

description: Fantastic gem of a coffee shop! Think Ritual, Four Barrel, Sightglass, etc but more cozy, warm, comforting, and quaint. Although they don't have a single pour over coffee bar, their drip coffee quality was just as amazing: fruity nose, full body, amazing mouth-feel, long finish. All coffee is freshly roasted in their small facility, all pastries are baked on-site, baristas were welcoming and friendly and without snobbery. Andytown is now my go-to coffee stop while driving through the city!
author: Matt F.

description: Great experience. A rare sunny Saturday morning, and a line out the door. Hubs and I brought the dogs and had a table outside after a short wait. We both ordered americanos (added steamed milk to mine, no issue or charge) and soda bread farls. We added jam to one, raw cheddar to the other, and it was plenty to split between the two - lightly toasted and delicious. We could easily have split one farl for two people. The coffee was perfect. We picked up a half pound of beans to bring with us ($9.50). One of my favorite SF roasters!
author: Laura M.

description: I always order the snowy plover and soda current scone, my morning ritual.  Great little coffee bar in the outer sunset!
author: Maggie M.

description:
Neefed a place to sit and do some work for a couple of hours. Sercvice was amazing! Everybody was super nice and friendly, madee feel welcome .
Hada double machiato, it was good, but nothing special. 
Only complain is that it was noisy for me. A lot people love this place, and I know why! Wish I wad the only one who knew about it...
author: Jack D.

description:
The Outer Sunset waited a long time for a place like this. With their unique identity and extremely courteous service, it's become our favorite spot for a coffee drink and a snack. Their latte is hands down one of my top fives...ever!  The snowy plover is delicious, but in a different way. 

Now for their baked goods - the soda bread is absolutely fantastic. Add butter and raw cheddar, or jam, or do the seasonal special. You can't go wrong!  Their scones, muffins, and other goodies all a real treat too. You can't go wrong with this place!

Michael and his wife are very friendly and will have you feeling very welcomed. Stop by but only tell your good friends about this spot :)
author: Jimbowicz J.

description: I come here every Sunday and have not once been disappointed. The staff are awesome, the drinks are amazing and consistent, scones awesome, and the bagged beans are always fresh and amazing. The line is absolutely worth it!
author: Liz F.

description: I caved in today and finally stopped by for a snowy plover. It tasted... interesting? For lack of a better word. But I liked it! If you're sensitive to dairy, be careful about the whipped cream--tasty but rich! The line was horrendously long but moved fairly quickly, and the cashier was quick to answer any questions I had. Great location (close to Ocean Beach), too!
author: Alexa A.

description:
Solid coffee in the sunset. Popular too so be prepared to wait. A mellow corner shop at its finest. 

1. Beans roasted in house
2. Baked goodness 
3. Short stroll to the beach
author: Martin R.

description:
For someone who is not a coffee drinker, I love Andytown! The quality of their drinks and food as well and the quality of their service is the tops, and I'm so happy to have them as my neighborhood coffee spot.

Usually I get their infamous snowy plover - sweet, delicious, and does it's job. I bring my friends from out of town here pretty often, and they like their regular coffees and lattes. I'm more keen to the pastries. Their scones are to die for and their bread is extremely fresh and sells out  ridiculously fast. 

The vibe they set is welcoming and everyone who works there makes you feel right at home. They also have great wifi and tables to sit at if you need to do work. My only gripe is that there are no outlets at the big table so my work sessions are cut short, but i guess that means more people can enjoy Andytown. 

Definitely a go-to place in the Sunset!
author: Kristine T.

description: Everyone knows about the snowy plover but don't sleep on the caps and lattes. I come here a lot! Amazing coffee and super friendly staff. The neighborhood go-to.
author: d n.

description: Wow, the snowy plover is the best espresso beverage that I've ever had in my life. Can't wait to go back for more! Really cute place and service was great.
author: Ariana V.

description: Really liked their Snowy Plover! An iced drink with espresso and Pellegrino. Just think of it like a carbonated cup of coffee. It's actually quite a strong cup of coffee, but very unique. It may sound a bit weird, but it was delicious! But it might not be everyone's cup of coffee. Not only does Andytown have drinks, they also have scones and muffins. I've been here twice and tried a few of their pastries and my favorite is their Strawberry Corn Muffin. I came here early enough in the morning to try it fresh out of the oven. It's soft on the inside and crispy on the outside edges. Just a heads-up, make sure to come early because they do sell out some of their popular muffins/scones fast. Andytown is definitely worth a try! :)
author: Philana C.

description:
Lawton Street in outer Sunset district SF is nothing but a blank cassette.
I mean, why do I have to come Lawton and 43rd Avenue? 
For what?
Am I lost?
I understand Irving and Judah for hang out, but, .... outer Sunset of Kirkham, Lawton and Moraga Street are so blank like desert.
There is no Asian Tea parlor, no pizza, no Asian market, no Chinese take out, nothing.
But....

If you see a faded sign by the side of the road that says

your what? 
muffin top, roasted!

Bacon raw cheese on Irish soda bread!
The legendary irish sausage rolls.
Strawberry corn muffin!!
And of course, home roast coffee was awesome!
author: Nobu K.

description: This is my second time coming to AT. The first time was to pick up a gift certificate for a coworker but I couldn't help myself and ended up getting a cheese and onion scone. It was delicious, flaky and not to dry. I came around 7:50am on a tuesday and there was a short line but it moved quick. I got a latte and AT only had almond milk, which I decided to try. The latte was good and it could have been warmer since I like my coffee HOT! I am not a big coffee drinker but it was good.  I ordered the blueberry corn muffin. It had a crispy golden sugary top and the rest of the muffin was a bit savory and sweet. Consistent with a corn muffin texture if that's what you like! I am pretty impressed with their pastries and would like to try more.
author: Rosanna T.

description: Amazing coffee.  I've been wanting to try the snowy plover for a while.  I mean sparkling water + espresso + whipped cream...would these work together?  You can clearly taste the pellegrino in the coffee, and it seems like it wouldn't work but it does. This is a surprisingly delicious concoction. Definitely a must try!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Snowy Plover. That's all you need to know.

Okay and the baked goods are deeeeelicious. Everyone is so friendly. I love strolling over with my baby who gets plenty of attention and entertainment while we pay and wait for our goodies. Love the neighborhood vibe.
author: Chrisy C.

description:
Holy crap what a find! We happened to be nearby and looking for coffee, and were lucky enough to stumble upon Andytown! We got coffee as well as some baked goods for breakfast. The muffins were delicious. Great flavor combinations, and very moist. For coffee, I got the snowy plover, which is like an espresso soda with whipped heavy cream on top. Sounded very weird, and I was a little hesitant to try it, but it ended up being AMAZING. Like, seriously one of the best coffee beverages I have ever had. It's sort of like a coffee flavored homemade cream soda. I wanted to get another one immediately.

This place goes to show that all those lists of "Best coffee shops in town" that keep listing the same places over and over again are far from exhaustive. I will definitely be back, hopefully sooner rather than later.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Move over blue bottle, andytown is coming to town!  Blue bottle has been my all time favorite for awhile in SF, but andytown really won me over with the snowy plover and delicious lattes and pastries.

Stumbled upon andytown at the outskirts of town, and glad i made the choice to check out this coffee shop!   The snowy plover is the way to go, even on a cold morning i enjoyed it, and i was really feeling something warm.  The concoction sounds so funky and strange that i almost didn't want to order it, afraid i would be dissapointed; but it works.  Perfect smooth coffee balance and flavor, and the dollop of heavy sweetened cream on top just makes this drink perfect to sip on!  Go for the snowy plover, for the win!  .  

I also tried a latte, its stronger than most with nice coffee flavor, not too bitter.  They really know how to pull a nice shot.  Only wish my coffee art was perfected, guess they could work on their coffee art.  Blue bottle might still make a better latte only because they use richer whole milk, but its more personal preference.

The jalapeno cornbread muffin is good, but wished there was more jalapeno and cheese.  Its a rather larger muffin, big enough for two people to share.

Only downside is the place is really small and only a few small interior tables, not meant for sitting down to catch up with friends.  The line is long and wraps outside, so be prepared to wait.  This is more of a grab and go local coffee joint, but its the best in the sunset!  I will be back for more snowy plover, lattes, and delicious pastries :)
author: Terence N.

description:
Comes to NO SURPRISE that Andytown has a five star rating!  Like not surprised at all because as far as I'm concerned Andytown is as good as it gets!

I've been to Andytown about a dozen times, and each time my drink and muffin on point and all served quickly by friendly baristas and staff.  Admittedly, I always order either a Snowy Plover or a latte, creature of habit, I am.  Let's talk about the Snowy Plover for a second - a shot of espresso over ice with Pellegrino and topped off with dollop of fresh whipped cream - are you kidding me?  The espresso is so balanced and even a tad sweet that you don't need sugar.  Completely mix in the whipped cream or not, it's the most perfect iced coffee.  The latte is great, too; perfect temperature and again so balanced that I only use one teaspoon of sugar whereas I would normally use 2 or 3 at other coffee houses.  

And the scones!  Savory or sweet, you can't go wrong with either. I often choose the gluten free option - which often is the strawberry corn muffin - and I love it.  Does not taste gluten free, texture is like any corn muffin, and berries are bursting out of the muffin. I especially enjoy it when it's still warm.

I don't get to Andytown often, but when I do, it brightens up my morning what with the delicious offerings and smiling staff. I arrive at work (after a 45 minute commute) with an empty coffee cup and nearly finished muffin, ready to start the work day.
author: Marie B.

description:
Went here to try their specialty, the Snowy Plover! Espresso with sparkling water and yummy homemade whipped cream. At first sip I thought the drink was a little weird, but as I kept drinking the more and more I liked it. It's like a coffee soda.

The coffee shop is small, but cute. There are a few tables outside, a couple small tables along the wall and a communal table in the front corner. The scones and muffins look delicious and I'll have to come back to try them.
author: Annaliese D.

description: My most favorite place in all the city! Must try the apple pear corn muffin with raspberry jam pocket inside. Its heavenly!!! The staff is so kind and their lattes are creamy and delicious!!!
author: Sierra M.

description:
this is one of my favorite place to go!!!!! for these reasons:
coffee is superb
people are super friendly
plenty of parking spots
and the coffee is not super expensive
excellent place to hang out
I wish they close a little later!!!!
author: Cecilia C.

description: Andytown is a must whenever I come to SF. The Snowy Plover has become my favorite here as it's a unique espresso drink that you can't find anywhere else. Ask for extra whipped cream! The drip coffee is very flavorful with strong notes of chocolate and red fruit. They always have a nice assortment of yummy interesting pastries, today I tried the elderflower shortbread cookie and it was delicious. I'm in love with the atmosphere, and the staff here is great too. This is a busy place but it's worth the wait!
author: Sophia S.

description:
Stopped off here after a hike around Land's end with some friends and they recommended this place. It's a cute place and looks like they have pretty good coffee. It was a really hot day and it was also late in the day so I wasn't really hankering a cup of joe but I did have their signature iced drink with soda water and coffee and cream on top? It was ok, tasted like a coffee soda. It was very interesting. 

I'd love to come back to try their coffee and maybe purchase one of their adorable dino coffee mugs!
author: Christine W.

description: The snowy plover is one of the greatest coffee drinks to be found anywhere. Forgive Andytown's remote location, it is a very special place.
author: Sebastian M.

description: Snowy plover for the win!!!!!! I have never been so addicted to something soooo much! I've lived 3 blocks away from Andytown almost all my life and have never tried it until one of my girlfriends mentioned the spot to me just the other day! And boy ...... Since last week, I've been there 3x already and I still wanted more! Ive ordered the snowy plover and the cornbread muffin every time !!! Its been amazing! Service was great, food was great! Must try!!! You won't regret it!
author: Kelly C.

description: They're alright. I like their store ambiance. I got two scones to go (cheese/scallion and blueberry) which were pretty good, but not the best. I preferred the blueberry one over the cheese scone. I think the part that irked me a bit was the fact that they're pretty tiny, but costs over $3 a piece. Pricey even for SF. Tried their snow plover and I can see why it's unique. It's basically soda water with espresso and a cream float on top. Coffee soda is very interesting, and I guess I found out that it was not my cup of joe. I'm not sure if I'll be back, but if I'm in the area and I have extra money to spare, I suppose why not. Otherwise, I probably won't make a trip here on purpose.
author: Julia P.

description:
Im going to make a bold statement and say that Andytown is the best coffee shop I have been to in America...yes I really did say that!  I travel to SF about 3X a month and thanks to Andytown, I am on the hunt to find a coffee shop as good as this place in my hometown of Seattle...still searching as we speak.    

COFFEE:
This is literally one of the best tasting/roasts of coffee I have ever had.  I usually get an Americano or Cappucino.  Everytime I have been here, the coffee is consistent with flavor and temperature.  Their is always a nice film of natural coffee oils on top of my Americanos.  I have also had their famous snowy plover, but am not a huge fan of sweeter/coffee drinks.  Still a fabulous drink, but not my cup of tea.  Seriously the best Americano & Cappucino i have ever had though.

BAKED GOODS:
Their baked good are excellent!  Consistently fresh and tasty!  The last handful of times I went, I had their Apple & Pear Corn Muffin, Ginger scone w/Apricot Jam center and their Cheddar Scallion Scone.  All equally delicious, but I think I am more of a fan of their corn muffins.  

Great coffee shops.  There is usually a line outside, but well worth the wait.  Also, they're pretty quick making their drinks, so the wait isnt too bad.  I seriously look forward to my visits to SF knowing that Ill be having a cup of coffee at Andytown!
author: Erik H.

description: Andytown is like no other. They have excellent service and their drinks are amazing. I introduced my friends to this coffee shop and they all love it. If you haven't tried Andytown yet, you're missing out!
author: Alan D.

description: My friend brought me here for the first time and it was so good! I think I had the iced espresso, and it had this foam. I don't remember exactly what it was called, since my friend just insisted I have it and ordered it for me while I got the table. But it probably is the best iced espresso I've had so far. Something about that foam just gave it this milky and creamy taste that was just so amazing. Service is also efficient. When we got there, the line seemed long so I was worried we'd be waiting long, but it moved quick. Also, at first I didn't see any tables and was thinking, where the heck are we gonna sit? But there's some tables in the back and some outdoor seating off to the side.
author: Jasmine L.

description: I only tried the Snowy Plover and I'm definitely gonna come back to try the other drinks. The Snowy Plover is a combination of an espresso shot, Pellegrino, and cream. If you don't like the taste of Pellegrino, you probably won't like it your first try. I really enjoyed it because the Pellegrino took away that weird film you get on your tongue after drinking coffee/dairy products. Interesting combo but the Pellegrino made it very refreshing.
author: Fiona C.

description: Super cute coffee shop with friendly staff and delicious drinks. They make great coffee and their baked goods are so yummy, we always try to resist and then can't. Their service is also great! They greet you, take your order and help you however they can with a smile. I didn't realize how much I really appreciated this until I went to a horribly rude cafe a few blocks over. They're also very dog friendly which is nice, they have a bowl of water for your pup outside and treats to spoil them too.
author: Kathleen D.

description: My favorite coffee place in SF now. It worths the drive from SOMA. We got latte with whip cream. Very friendly staff as well.
author: Ryosuke K.

description:
Coffee-dates. I love them. Andytown is definitely the place to be. They have delicious homemade muffins and really unique specialty coffees. The interior of this coffee shop is gorgeous. The only downside is that it's a bit tiny inside. But I guess that's what makes this place cozy. There are a couple of seats outdoors if you're lucky enough to snag them. The coffee is pretty good, not too bitter and not too sweet either. I usually get mocha's wherever I go.

They change their corn-muffins frequently. When I came they had an apple-pear corn muffin filled with raspberry jam. AMAZING and pretty big! It was about $3 something. Shareable... But why would you?
author: Laura T.

description:
Wow..you have to try the Snowy Plover it taste like coffee but you feel like you are drinking a soda. .outside seating 
Be ready for a line but it goes fast.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Since word in the Andytown is the Snowy Plover, I had to come try it for myself.

Snowy Plover (turns out it was named after a bird under Wildlife Protection, found this out as I was walking along the beach!) is an interesting invention: sparking water, espresso, whipped cream on top. Never would I have thought that such a combination can work, but it does! I can imagine how refreshing this concoction can be on a hot sunny day. Unfortunately, the day I had the drink was rather cold, and it took me forever to drink, so the fizziness of the water was gone by the time I reached halfway. I recommend downing it as fast as possible!

Meanwhile, the raspberry and blackberry cornbread was absolutely delicious, and something that I would definitely get whenever I visit here. Cornbread and a warm cup of latte = perfect combination.

I do wish the place was bigger though. It isn't really a working/ studying-friendly coffee shop (only one medium sized table out in the front where you can awkwardly sit as people line up around it to get their caffeine fix). Thus, I suggest a nice long walk along the beach to accompany your coffee instead :)
author: Mandy C.

description: Not a huge fan of the single origin coffee fad, but I know most people geek out over it. That said, the almond milk latte is really good and so are their scones and bread.
author: Rex L.

description: Simply great coffee drinks. Great beans and skilled baristas. Baked goods are also good but come for the coffee.
author: Neil B.

description: First time came here and I loved it.  I tried their signature drink, Snowy plover.  The drink was expresso with carbonated water.  It tasted something different.  I also ordered a scone.  It was so good and BIG.
author: Liza T.

description:
Good service. Line out the door at 2 pm on Saturday, but it moved quickly. Cafe is cute & close to Ocean Beach. The baked goods & Snowy Plover, their coffee soda with whipped cream, appear to be popular. 

But I was in search of a good espresso or Americano, and was disappointed with what I was served, doubly so because I had high hopes since this place roasts its own beans and one of the founders was a head barista at Blue Bottle. The espresso was very bitter and burnt tasting - overextracted, perhaps? They don't know how to make an Americano properly. The guy put the espresso in the cup first, then poured boiling water (too hot!) over it, destroying the crema. Still in search of a good espresso and Americano, with good taste, good crema, and coffee that stands on its own without sugar, milk, soda water or whipped cream.
author: Deb L.

description: The Snowy Plover is real. The scone & cornbread muffin were also very nice. I like the spot and the servers were very friendly.
author: Ameer N.

description: Post our phantasmagorical visit to The Great Highway art gallery next door, we were positively delighted by the staff and ambiance of Andytown. From a self proclaimed coffee snob, Andytown's brews are perfection. Love some of their other five yelp reviews :)
author: Mario L.

description: This place is super cute. It's a small corner cafe, and when I say small I mean small. I think maybe 15 people can sit in there. Their pastries looked delicious and the soda bread that you can add cheddar and bacon too sounded bomb. I got a snowy plover per my friends request because she says "I don't know if I hate it or love it". I believe the snowy plover is coffee with Pellegrino and creme fraiche on top. Sounds weird but has an interesting taste, I am now at that crossroads as my friend. I can't tell if I love it or hate it. It's good but when you first sip it you get the Pellegrino carbonation which is just interesting in a coffee drink. The coffee in the snowy plover was delicious so I would definitely go back to try a coffee and soda bread with cheddar and bacon.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
The lines have gotten ridiculous. When we first started frequenting Andytown, we felt like we were stopping by a neighborhood spot. Now we often get deterred when we drive by and see the line waaay out the door. 

But, it is still my favorite, so it deserves the 5 stars. Take over a larger space. Or open a 2nd location -- like on my street.  

Coffee- Snowy Plover, try it. It is bubbly like a coffee soda, the perfect dollop of cream, the slight salty/sour fizzy water. I could drink this all day (in the summer). The lattes are also wonderful. 

Food -- amazing. The beautiful seasonal artisan muffins. The buttery and flakey sausage roll. The soda bread topped with bacon. 

The store is understated perfect. The FLOWERS the flowers - kudos mystery flora hobbyist friend of Andytown. The reclaimed wood table. The beautiful mugs and wood blocks they send their food out on. Free wifi but minimal seating. Went on a Friday to do work, there was nowhere to park. If it's a warm day, though, there are tables at the side of the building which you can also bring your pup to. 

Oh and the people are just marvelous. Super kind. Very patient. Very knowledgable. Very cool. Very friendly.
author: Subie C.

description: I was looking for a coffee shop to explore in the city, and considering how beautiful the day was, I wanted to stay in the outer sunset area to be near home and near the beach. Upon a quick yelp search, the solid rating and reviews brought my attention to andytown roasters and it did not disappoint me at all. The staff were all friendly, the snowy plover was conceptually strange but delicious (will definitely be coming back for this)! I also had their pear and jam cornbread which was probably the best cornbread snack I've ever had. All in all, great spot to do work accompanied with great coffee and snacks. 5-5.
author: Zara F.

description:
if you haven't tried their snowy plover, you're missing out in life. 

in general, if you haven't tried this delicious establishment, you are missing out. their coffee is honestly the best I've had. i am no coffee connoisseur but I'd like to think I know what I like and what tastes good.
author: C C.

description: I really liked Andytown when it first opened. It was a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Now they have grown beyond their capacity and it's no longer worth going there. Twice now I have ordered the same thing I always do and the barista asked if I wanted it sweetened. I want it the way it has always been prepared. It's a menu item and I've never asked for modifications. Twice now I've received inconsistent drinks that simply taste terrible. Andytown lacks standards and needs to shape up.
author: Rich F.

description: Oh Andytown how I love thee!  The snowy plover has changed my life and combined my love for coffee, sweets, and bubbles all in one delicious drink!
author: Krystal L.

description: Great service! Cute ambiance. It's a little cosy but on a nice day there is outdoor seating with a semi view of the ocean. A big plus is that it's open at 7am!
author: Shristi R.

description:
maybe i caught them on an off day, but i don't think i can quite agree with all of the 5-star reviews. for the insane line, i didn't think the coffee was worth it. it's GOOD coffee, definitely, but it took me 45 minutes to get a latte. i came here because i was interested in their pastries, which i'd heard great things about, but mine was definitely overcooked and the flavor was not pleasing. it was like, berries inside of dried, flaky corn bread. i was surprised they served one that was so charred. i probably should have said something, but the line was sooooo long i couldn't get anyone's attention! but hey, it's pretty popular and probably for good reason. obviously it's good coffee and a cool shop, just not worth it for the line.

two other thoughts:
1. baristas, why were you ALL wearing orange beanies? is that a uniform, or do you all have the same taste in beanies?
2. that table in the corner by the front door is AMAZINGGGG. anyone know where they got it? 
3. it's a small shop so obviously they had to get creative with indoor seating. what they did looks cool, but it's really not that comfortable or realistic for sitting and having a conversation with someone over coffee.
author: Elise B.

description:
Andytown makes iced mochas ($4.75) just the way I like them (bittersweet, actually espresso-y) and they also happen to make the best whipped cream ever. I eat most of it off the top of my drink every time... it's just so good. 

The Snowy Plover ($4) is also a fun drink if you're looking for something special and out of the ordinary!  

Also, the people that work here are super friendly. Win win.
author: Maci B.

description:
Andytown is top notch! Everything is delicious! The snowy plover is everything that everyone talks it up to be. An innovative gift to coffee and those who enjoy a sweet treat from time to time. 
The management is amazing, with community and sustainability in mind while maintaining excellent quality, and they're always friendly!
Top notch I dare say, top notch!
author: David H.

description:
"Snowy plover". This is the biggest joke ever. Espresso and syrup, poured over ice, topped with sweetened whipped cream. Oh, forgot the worst part - fucking Pellegrino. 

(The baristas were nice.)
author: L Stephanie L.

description:
If I could grab all the stars in the sky and use it to rate the whipped cream at Andytown-- I would do so faster than you can say coffee. There's just something so magical about their whipped cream that, upon first taste, all dreams of dieting, eating healthy, and working out are diminished.

I've been to Andytown three times and have tried the snowy plover, latte, and mocha. At first I was hesitant to try a drink that was a mixture sparkling water and espresso (hmmm coffee soda, really?), but it just works (did I mention the spoonfuls of whipped cream that comes with the drink?!). Props to them for the creativity. The latte and mocha were also brilliantly crafted. The strawberry corn muffin was not bad either-- wouldn't say it's amazing though.  All in all, you will not be disappointed (except for the fact that close at 3PM).

Wake up. Drank. (coffee, that is.)
author: Annie C.

description:
Happy birthday Andytown!! (22Mar2015)
Staff is super friendly, place is small but nice. And the coffee...all the hype is real
author: Ed O.

description: The BEST coffee in the outer sunset. High quality drip coffee and a gem in the neighborhood.
author: Legendary W.

description: Once you've had the Snowy Plover, forget other fancy drinks.  Nothing compares to how delicious this drink can be.  I was not overly awed by their drip coffee in the beginning, but the Snowy Plover impressed me.  I'm not always a fan of sweet coffee drinks, but the whipped cream that's put on top is addictive.  The Pellegrino with espresso made for an interesting experience.  The bitter taste of coffee along with the fizz of the sparkling water and then the sweetness of the cream leads your tongue to wonder what it's tasting.  So just order and try it.
author: Karen L.

description:
"I feel so hipster"

The words we both uttered as we crossed the threshold of Andytown Coffee Roasters.

Parking: Super easy we parked right in front on a Sunday afternoon about 1 pm

Ambiance: clean and casual 

Coffee:  I just ordered a black coffee cause I'm a bad a$$ and don't take no creamers
and plus that's how you can tell if you have good coffee or not...and yes this is GREAT COFFEE. I was hungover and this kept me awake and alert the remainder of the evening. 

Price: Definitely more than I'd like to spend on one coffee, but I was not in the mood for sad watery SBux coffee even though this is easily twice the price. 

I also tried my friend's Snowy Plover, because we couldn't come here and not order that considering all the hype it gets.  It was quite an interesting experience...I can appreciate it, it's special and I would order it myself when I return.  I was expecting it to be a lot sweeter than it was, however it was still refreshing and delicious none the less.  The carbonation and the cream mix together to form a magical experience that any appreciator of coffee would enjoy. 

Do get caffeinated here!
author: Christina L.

description:
A cute coffee shop in the Sunset, just what the neighborhood needs. :)

What sets this place apart aside from it's various muffins and pastries is one drink in particular. The Snowy Plover. I had heard about this crazy drink of sparkling water, espresso and whipped cream and knew I had to try it... and I definitely did. While I can't say I'd order it again, it was definitely a unique, fun, and sweet (I normally just drink black coffee) drink.

I also tried the cornmeal muffin because it was fresh out of the oven and it was delicious. Now, just give me some butter and it might take it to another level.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
When I first heard about this place, I was sentimentally biased against it, since, well, before Andytown, there was another coffee shop here which donated a lot to my local elementary school just down the block. Sad to see it go...

...but glad to see that it's been replaced by a great new coffee shop! Staff is super friendly (they even rapped a little when I asked for a business card) and really know the menu. Baked goods are phenomenal - and fresh out of the oven for most of the day. Coffee beans are roasted; by far some of the coffee drinks I've ever had. For those who are unsure about trying the Snowy Plover: it's pretty much coffee soda. Like, Sprite without the taste of lemon-lime-sugar, and with the taste of bold, dark espresso. (Which is what it literally is - Pellergino, shot of espresso, and homemade whipped cream). You might grimace when you first try it, but it'll make sense. It always does. 

Bonus points: dinosaurs in the potted plants. I'll be back.
author: Bobby W.

description:
Went here again to introduce my friend to the amazingness that is andytown. Kevin our barista was amazing and patient in helping us out and explaining what they had to offer we ended up opting for a snowy plover a tea au lait and a wheaten bread with seasonal spread everything was wonderful. Always packed but always worth the wait. 

Thanks so much to Kevin and andytown for a wonderful experience.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Coffee: A+
Food: A+
Customer Service: A+

So happy to see this place in the Sunset!

Between burnt coffee at Beanery, douchebaggery at Trouble, homeless camp at Starbucks, etc. it's been hell to try to get decent coffee in the neighborhood.

Problem solved.

Coffee is on par with the best in the City (Four Barrel, Blue Bottle, Ritual, Sightglass, etc.)
Bakery goods are at least equal to and I'd even say better than Arizmendi.
Everyone working here has a great attitude.
And there was a lot of obvious thought given to such details as no silly hand blowers in the bathroom and providing hooks under the tables and in the bathroom so you don't have to toss your bag on the ground.

I'm going to call it how I see it...

Andytown: top coffeehouse in the City
author: Chuck G.

description: I was in the area looking for coffee and ended up here. After waiting in a long line that took about 15 minutes. I got a cappuccino. There's only one word to describe it: perfection. One of the best tasting cappuccinos I have had. There were a bunch of other people buying muffins. I'll be back for some more coffee and to try the muffins.
author: Steven B.

description: Snowy Plover and a warm strawberry corn muffin, warm and frequent(!) sunshine balancing the cool winds of the Pacific rolling up the block and you have my favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.  Great interior design too.  This place has made the Sunset a destination for many non-surfers (along with Devil's Teeth and Outerlands).
author: Rob P.

description: Amazing soda bread! Got the Wheaten Bread with butter and jam, and a hot pot of Early Grey tea. Staff was friendly and fast, everything was delicious! And double points for jamming Destiny's Child, stayed longer than planned to soak in the cute decor, savor my bread, and sing along :)
author: Daniika V.

description: Great coffee, great pastries, great vibe!  The best place to go for a cup in the sunset!
author: Calvin J.

description: Wow!  This was an unexpected find while making my way through the outer sunset.  What an incredible mocha - perfectly composed and topped with a fluff of happiness (best hand whipped cream ever).  The currant scone was fresh out of the oven and delightful.  All the pastries/food items looked amazing - it was super hard to pick.  The staff was engaging and cheerful which is always a plus when dealing with people before you get your morning coffee.  ;-)  I will definitely be back!
author: Samantha M.

description: The sunset district in San Francisco is where all the hidden gems are located. This place is beyond amazing. The scones and pastries are little bites of heaven. The coffee should be given some credit too. The best item in their menu would be the Snowy Plover, which is pretty much a sparkling coffee float with fresh whip cream on top. It's a cute little shop that has seating indoors and outside. The tables are decorated with beautiful plants and flowers. The baristas are super friendly too! There will always be a line but it's worth the wait!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Coffee is great. They even make a vegan version of the Snowy Plover by making it with almond milk & leave off the whipped cream (which I know is a big part of the drink, but it was really good w/o).

(wish they had soy milk instead of just almond- almond milk covers up the taste of the coffee more than soy milk does).

Super happy they offer wifi, because that seems to be hard to find at specialty coffee shops, which I get, but someone's gotta do it!  There has to be SoMe place you can go to study/work and also enjoy GREAT coffee.

Atmosphere is nice. Clean. Bright. Positive. Modern.

They have gluten free baked goodies sometimes, which is great because my hubby has Celiac's disease.  However....1 vegan goody option would be great so I don't have to sneak my own in ; )
author: Lisa M.

description: Talented baristas, quality products, nice digs. We ordered an Americano and a latte and enjoyed both - the berry pastry was amazing. There was a line at opening. Good place to go on a lazy weekend morning - not sure if it would be as great if you were in an hurry.
author: Chris R.

description: SNOWY PLOVER!!! the first time i tried it I thought it was gross because i didn't mix it..
author: Judy C.

description:
Solid working/chilling spot!
Friendly service!
Delicious snacks! 
Strong free wifi!
Seating outside for sunny warm days, seating inside for cold evenings.

I'm not a coffee person but a hot chocolate and while it's not the best hot chocolate I've ever had it's decent mix.
author: Rohan D.

description:
There's a reason every review but one is 5 stars. Because this place is a GEM. Everything here is perfect and done with the utmost detail and forethought. For instance, the interior was designed the way it was to accentuate the natural light and ambiance from the beach. The cups were designed specifically to hold well (read: your fat fingers will fit in the handle, the handle is no just there for decoration) by a local ceramic artisan AND were designed to be "nice to pour into". Details. They've got a beautiful community table, a row of workstations all with plugs for your laptop as well as outdoor seating. 

So all the above doesn't really matter if the coffee sucks, right? Right. Well, relax, the coffee is amazing. All their beans are roasted in-house and their perfectly-tuned espresso machine turns out what's easily the best shot of espresso west of Divis, maybe the whole city. Who knows, I stopped going anywhere but Andytown.
author: Johnson M.

description: Best coffee joint in the sunset! Baristas are friendly and the line moves fairly quickly in the mornings. The breakfast pastries are made in house and are always delectable. Some interesting combinations too like persimmon and goat cheese muffins. They also have gluten free items as well. The staple item is the cheddar and chive muffin.
author: Cynthia J.

description: I come here 3-4 times a week to get a savory scone and almond latte. I have yet to have a bad experience. The coffee is one of the best I've ever had and their baked goods are out of this world. I only wish it was a little more unknown because it's packed here all the time but the line moves along quickly. If you're in the area it's a must-try.
author: Tselmeg S.

description:
I love coffee...just the simple drip kind where you can really taste the flavor and richness of the brew. Nothing jumps at me like a little neighborhood cafe that's BRIGHT, CLEAN and serve their very own UNIQUE baked goods and coffee drinks like Andytown! Oh my goodness, the coffee is definitely has a kick here! Yum!

Andytown does not look like it belongs in the neighborhood because it's so bright and clean-cut compared to the buildings around. However, you cannot miss this neighborhood gem because there will be a line (that moves pretty fast). There is a large communal table for sitting inside as well as three tiny sitting or standing table on the side. There is also few tables outside along with benches. For those who don't have a table, the staffs give you this cute little wooden board to put your pastry and coffee on while sitting on the bench or standing outside...very considerate and thoughtful! 

The staffs here were so nice and friendly. Most importantly, they look like they have fun while they work, and put their hearts into the coffee they put together.
author: Mandy C.

description: Love local businesses like these!  Smaller menu of beverage offerings than typical chain coffee places but I prefer it that way.  Sweet and savory scones fresh out of the oven.  Had a Snowy Plover with extra whip and a cheddar scallion scone. I have to say that simple as it was, it had to have been one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while. Only downside was that seating is very, very limited.
author: Jiki B.

description: We stopped on our way out of SF and waited in line for about 15 minutes on a Saturday morning. it was worth the wait. their lattes were great and I split a soda current scone with my girlfriend. it was right balance of sweet due to the currents. there is plenty of street parking but there isn't a lot of seating inside. the line seems longer than it is because the cash register is just inside the door.
author: Mario C.

description:
I would argue they changed my life, but that is a long story. 

The short version is that their Snowy Plover, scones, staff, owners, and space are AMAZING. If you believe in good aura, they have tons of it and it radiates from their coffee shop. 

Things that may be good to know in advance:
-limited seating inside
-free wifi (just ask!)
-lines on weekends
-limited hours
author: Crystal S.

description:
Legit coffee in Outer Sunset.  Try the Snowy Plover.  It is divine and is easily one of my favorite drink concoctions.  It will be yours too.

They have fantastic home made goods such as cheddar scallion scones, blueberry muffins, and sausage rolls.  I love the soda bread with added cheddar & bacon.  My favorite in house item is their whip cream actually.  Get a Snowy Plover and use it's whip on their heart shape cacao nib cookie.

Besides their food offerings, it's the little things in their shop that keeps me coming back.  The flowers they put into their little table vases are always stunning.  The big windows that look out into Lawton, where a plethora of dogs wait outside for their masters.  The handy bicycle pump that's free to use for their 2-wheeled patrons.

I don't know how to end this review.  So this is the end.
author: Abe F.

description:
I came with a friend last week who always orders Mochas when we have coffee together.  Although I usually order Americanos, today I ordered a Mocha, same as she.  I thought it was amazing, and she said it was the best Mocha she's had.

I went on my own today and I ordered the Snowy Plover like everyone else in line.  OMG, that was the best iced drink I have ever had.  

I love this place!
author: Andrea S.

description:
I woke up stoked about coffee one weekend morning and decided to take a trip to Andytown Coffee roasters to try a good cup and hopefully, score some killer beans to brew back at home. It's all about the journey and I didn't mind taking the trek across town to sample the goods, it made me feel like an urban coffee bean hunter.

I patiently waited in the small line that seemed to be just outside the door when suddenly I was punched in the face by the smell of baked goods fresh off the oven, I could almost see the steam rising off those gigantic blueberry corn muffins. 

I was greeted at the counter, and I failed to quickly respond still unconscious from the intoxicating smells coming off  the pastries, I remembered saying 'hello, good..morning.' I quickly got it together and ordered a coffee and asked about the beans that were displayed behind me. I was looking for a tasty blend to use for espresso, cappuccinos, and something that would work for brewing as well. I believe I was speaking with Michael, he proceeded to elaborate on a particular espresso blend that had its origins in Brazil/Ethiopia. He told me that his Brazil was single origin, (a season's worth of beans harvested from one plantation) and roasted just a few days ago. He looked quite serious about this blend, and somehow I knew this was the one. I noticed I walked out with my bag and coffee in hand and didn't grab one of those muffins...no bueno.

The Brazil/Ethiopian blend was delicious, the coffee had a very nice body - bright notes of caramel, peach, and a very earthy bottom that kept me sipping more. Nice, feel good about yourself kinda buzz this coffee is very, and I mean very fragrant and is a pleasure to smell every time I'm using the grinder. Overall very satisfied with my beans, I really wished I would of picked up more coffee but that will have to wait until next trip.
If you really like your coffee, stop by Andytown's and treat yourself to a good cup.
author: Sky A.

description: Cute place! Not suitable for sitting and sipping coffee with a book though. It's more of a to go place. Coffee has a unique taste. Come try it! Scones and muffins are delicious!!! I liked the soda bread too.
author: Chow C.

description: I thought the concept for the Snowy Plover was interesting. It's basically a coffee cream soda Personally I wasn't a big fan but it is worth a try.
author: Aaron C.

description: The best coffee I have found in San Fran. And they make amazing scones/biscuits and a range of flavors and gluten free too!!!! This is a must try place. It's small but delicious
author: Hayley P.

description: I go here almost every day.. Everything  here is just the best..drinks, staff, hygiene, fresh baked food..definitely one of the reasons after the beach to live in sunset district.
author: Sidhartha I.

description: I'm officially obsessed with everything this corner coffee shop has to offer! Friendly staff, clean cafe, super yummy coffee and baked goods!!! My faves drinks are the Almond Latte w/syrup and Snowy Plover. And as for baked dough, definitely their cheese scallion scone and Asparagus Goat Cheese scone. I come here on a weekly basis and the goods never fail!
author: Dee T.

description: Excellent and fresh coffee. The pastries look amazing. I'll try them next time
author: Felicia B.

description:
Arguably the best coffee in town and some of the nicest staff you'll find. If you're looking for a good cup of coffee/espresso, Andytown is definitely worth the trip to the Outer Sunset.

Drink - Mocha
Espresso: Pulled just right. Not burnt or blond.
Sweetness: Just a hint of sweetness. No need to add tons of sugar to cover up any unpleasant burnt flavors.
author: Mark L.

description:
I am so happy these folks opened up in my hood. Excellent pastries and coffee- the goat cheese scone and sausage rolls are awesome. The best part is the people that work here. Even though they are slammed, they are still über friendly- and very kid friendly. 
Thanks for coming to the Sunset Andytown!
author: Jennifer W.

description: I love everything about this neighborhood coffee shop. Their lattes and jam pocket corn muffins (gluten free) are superb! They have bike racks, pooch parking (and treats), and outdoor seating available.
author: Ana K.

description:
My new favorite place for espresso in the bay area, followed closely by Four Barrel and SightGlass.  Just so happens it's in the Outer Sunset, which is great for me, but not so great for others (especially with the 3pm closing time).  Muffins and scones are solid as well.

Been here close to a dozen times, always the same people and they definitely know what they're doing.  Never had a bad pull, about as consistent as it gets, be it at 2:30pm or 7am.  Very friendly, I get a smile, more than enough for me.

Parking is easy, it is the sunset.  Seating isn't great, by no means a coffice, it's tiny, and that's a good thing.  Never had an issue finding seating, but I don't mind sitting outside.
author: Kylor H.

description:
My kind of coffee shop - quaint (not in the old dusty pillows and chipped mugs kind of way), clean, friendly service and great coffee sans attitude.

Fresh homemade scones and muffins. Pro tip: pick the ones freshest out of the oven in lieu of eeny meeny miny moe technique.

After a nice morning walk on the beach...
enjoy a nice cup of almond milk latte ...
accompanied by a warm blueberry corn muffin...
out on the patio...
with the sun beating down on you...

Does life get any better?
author: Tee N.

description:
The Snowy Plover is just as good as everyone says it is, if not better. I'm a sucker for coffee but an even more so for cute coffee shops and this place was everything I love.
