Though it is a bit small inside, it's still a great spot. The baristas are all fairly kind and it has a cozy feel indoors. You can count on me to be back plenty more times.

My only downfall is that this place is closed on Mondays and closes at 3pm other days.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Lovely little café in the outer sunset. 
Super friendly staff that make great coffee and pastries! 
My go-to spot to pick up a latte and muffin to start my day off right!

Can't go wrong with an almond milk latte and strawberry corn muffin! The cheddar corn jalapeño muffin is yummy too! 

And if you're feeling adventurous, their special drink is the "Snowy Plover" - espresso with soda water topped with house made whipped cream. It's like a fizzy latte and the whipped cream is just to die for!
author: Sharon L.

description:
It's is a great spot for coffee lovers. I waited for them to open after they started a kickstarter campaign. It was worth the wait!

When I arrived there was this amazing smell of warm fresh baked goods baking in the oven.  I asked the gentleman behind the counter what is that amazing smell and he said it was the cheddar and scallion scone. Boy was that tasty! I also ordered the strawberry muffin and it was delicious. As you can tell, I have a pastry addiction.

 I ordered the Snowy Plover.I took one sip and all I have to say was WOWZA!. It was so effervescent and refreshing, it was a party in my mouth. A Snowy Plover is a coffee cream soda that consists of ice, sparkling water, a shot of espresso, a spoonful of magical syrup and a dollop of heavenly cream. 

The friendly staff is always welcoming and friendly. Also they take credit cards as well as Square wallet app which is great when I go for a jog and don't carry my wallet.
author: Loun P.

description: The blueberry corn muffin is the best muffin I've ever had! It's a must try! Cute shop, friendly baristas and I've bookmarked this place and will return for sure.
author: Christy H.

description:
One day, I was out on errands when my sister texted me to go get her some coffee from the newly opened Andytown.  I said, heck no, I aint your maid, go get it yourself.  A few days later, I dropped in for coffee and I have since regretted not coming in earlier.

I love Andytown! Their espresso makes me think to myself, what a wonderful world...cue Louis Armstrong.  When I feel a bit more indulgent, I go for the Snowy Plover.  I never knew how good an espresso x sparkling water concoction could be.  I shamelessly tried to replicate it and I am embarrassed to say it did not go well.  Their secret might be their quality ingredients or homemade whipped cream.  Either way, Andytown has me hooked and is my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood.
author: Renee L.

description: So many things to love about this place. Awesome staff, delicious coffee, the soda farls are delicious and a real taste of home. The real highlight amongst everything is the Snowy Plover, a delicious refreshing iced coffee soda.
author: Patrick O.

description:
You can't go wrong with a cup of coffee and one of their scones. I tried the snowy plover because it looked so good but had no idea what was in it since the menu is non-descriptive so I asked the barista who said it was amazing. It was a mixture of a latte and sparkling water topped with whipped cream..what a strange concoction. 

I do love their pastries the most though. It's usually different types every time I go in so it can be hit or miss depending on how picky you are. 

Overall it's really cute. I'm glad that the random residential block it's on is shaping up.
author: Anastasia P.

description: Perfectly roasted coffee and a little gem with an ocean breeze and friendly faces! My little get-a-way...in the sunset! Love it!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Really excellent spot with outdoor seating. There was a long line when we came here on a Sunday morning but it moved pretty quickly.

There is an incredible variety of pastries, both savory and sweet. We ordered 5 different ones and I think that's enough to say you can't go wrong with any of them. 

Great place to hang out on a lazy Sunday morning.
author: Cary L.

description: Oh. My. Gosh. Maybe THE BEST almond milk cappuccino I have ever had in my life!!! And I've had quite a few. This one takes the cake! BEST EVER! Cute establishment, friendly staff, and incredible coffee. Go here!!
author: Brittany R.

description: This place is most likely out of your way, but it's the best coffee I've had in SF! Fair warning that the lines can be a little long at times but the coffee is great and the pastries are exceptionally crafted. It's a little pricey, but no more than Four Barrel, Blue Bottle, etc.
author: Alex R.

description: Playing tourist in my old neighborhood and found this place had popped up. Had a snowy plover (espresso, brown sugar simple syrup, soda water,  and a generous plop of homemade whipped cream) that made me very happy even on a cold rainy day.  Next time in back in SF I might trek back out to the outer sunset again for one!
author: Lisa B.

description:
the snowy plover is my new favorite thing in life! think root beer float except its espresso in soda water, simple syrup and house made super thick, luscious whipped cream. i'm thoroughly loving this concoction of perfection. also, the cornmeal strawberry muffin was great and the sausage roll (albeit a tad too salty) is an excellent version of a pig in a blanket. 

the guy who was manning the cash register as well as making the drinks was extra friendly and has already gotten to know his regular customers by name. the interior is simple with accents of wood, lavender type plants and filament lights. i love this place and intend on frequenting it!
author: Regina C.

description:
Best coffee spot in the outer sunset. They have great coffee and good pastries. 

Tips: 

Snowy plover is awesome if you have never tried. 

Closes a bit on the early side. 

Line moves faster than it seems.
author: Griffith P.

description:
Good coffee, good tea, VERY friendly staff, free wifi, but very little seating. This place would be amazing if it was twice the size. There's one table inside crammed into the corner next to the line of people, so you always feel a bit cramped. There is some seating outside, but that's a no-go at times because of this SF weather and then being a few blocks from the ocean as well. 

*5 star coffee/staff/service, but I sometimes like to enjoy a cup of coffee while doing a bit of work on my computer and that's difficult to do here because of the extremely limited seating and small space.
author: Joey B.

description: I got the cheddar scone and it was AMAZING! It was extremely flavorful! It was my first time there and i was overwhelmed but the staff was kind and recommended me some good starters. Overall i loved the experience and the food/drinks.
author: Jade T.

description: Great coffee, delicious baked goods, and friendly staff! Try the espresso con panna.
author: Dana G.

description: Not much more I can say that hasn't already been said.  I usually go here for beans when I am in need and more recently grab the occasional snowy plover. The lines can be a little long during peak hours, but it is well worth the wait.  Shops like this and others nearby make the outer sunset one of my favorite parts of the city.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: There's really something special about this place. Good ambiance, strong coffee, baked goods to die for, and friendly staff!
author: Monica L.

description: Oh my gosh. The Snowy Plover is so good! I've never tried anything quite like this. I came here right after lunch so I was too full to try their delicious looking soda scones. But for sure next time! Just went there today and excited for my next Snowy Plover!
author: Amy X.

description:
Andytown is really good. 
It was hard to make it that far out in the outer avenues before 3pm, but I'm glad I did. 

Looks like they don't do pour over coffee but they made up for it with the warm from the oven strawberry cornbread muffins and cherry chocolate scones. 

The coffee on tap was a medium roast blend that was so satisfying I had to buy a bag to brew at home. This Wind and Sea blend is great brewed in a pour over cone. I can see the Blue Bottle connection here - kind of like an updated version of their Bella Donovan blend, also smartly packaged in small 8oz roast date-stamped bags. Fairly light roast with a lot of flavor and character, but avoids the sourness of under-roasted coffee. 

The decaf cappuccino was very good. Currently decaf is only available in espresso drinks. I'll forgive that because the people working there were really nice. 

This is an example of a newer generation roaster focusing on quality and keeping things simple.
author: RK W.

description:
Best cold drain in a rainy lazy afternoon.  Got to the site at 3pm.  Stayed for an hour.  The line never stopped.  As soon stepped foot into the place, I felt comfortable.  The service at the count was pleasant.  They answer all kind of question and still come up with a smile.  Now back to the coffee, that espresso, brown syrup, sparkling water and the thick home made wipe cream called "snowy clover" is amazing.  You have the enjoyment of the cold sparkling drain and the rich favored coffee at the same time.  Perfect combination.
Soda scone is good.  Moist and full of favor.
author: Sherman Y.

description:
Snowy Plover - Don't worry about feeling silly saying that out loud. I never would have thought these ingredient went well together but it's completely divine. Coffee lovers and those who are more indifferent about coffee could probably agree that this is a wonderful treat.

Friendly staff, great location away from the hustle and bustle. The shop is a bit small but there is outdoor seating. Overall a great place to bring a friend to catch up or a place to be a loner.

Friendly vibe and great coffee drinks - what else do you need?
author: Kameron V.

description:
Finally ... a coffee shop gem has opened in Outer Sunset! 

I came to Andytown after I read about the Snowy Plover on Yelp. I haven't tried their other drinks but the pastries and Snowy Plover are both very good. 

Andytown is a small place so it's more of a place to pick up something and go before you hit the beach or get your day started.
author: Thatcher H.

description: This place is my favorite coffee shop in SF. Their signature drink with the whipped cream is a must-have. Also the cute ginger is my favorite worker, he has such a vibrant energy he brings to the environment
author: Brittin H.

description: Ok seriously. Best shot of espresso I've ever had in my LIFE- it was thick and sweet and smooth and so delicious (my sister got espresso con pana, which I tasted). But we were both so ecstatic about the Snowy Plover. So flipping good. My sister was frightened by the whole club soda + espresso thing but when she tried mine she regretted not getting one herself. Don't be frightened, drink Snowy Plovers. Wish we had an Andytown in So.Cal- I'd be there daily!
author: Ashley A.

description: Quite possibly one of the best almond milk lattes I've had in the City. The vibe here is chill and they have plenty of pastries. Definitely give their soda bread a try. Friendly and helpful baristas. Grab a to-go cup and make the short walk over to Ocean Beach!
author: Eli F.

description: The Snowy Plover is a must try at Andytown. It always hits the spot on a warm and sunny SF afternoon. Pellegrino, espresso, brown sugar, and topped with homemade whipped cream make this iced drink a constant go-to. I have yet to find another iced coffee beverage that tops this one and whenever I'm in the area I have to get my snowy plover fix.
author: Irene M.

description: Great hot chocolate I love how they put a whip cream bear on top!!! I also love their cheese & scallion scone & their strawberry corn muffin. I love the decor! My mom says best coffee in the Outer Sunset!!!
author: SF K.

description: Everything about this place is on point. So I won't complain about how long the line can be.
author: Dylan A.

description:
I went here for the first time today and loved it! 

Atmosphere: It is a beautiful space.  The seating is limited, but well thought out for the space available.  There are 3 tiny tables along one wall, a larger community type table and outdoor tables.

Drinks:
Mocha- in the words of my husband "a solid mocha" - I am not really a mocha person, but he was a fan
Drip Coffee- tasty, roasted each Wednesday
Snowy Plover- Wow! This was amazing.  It is like a coffee cream soda- the perfect balance of sweet, coffee, & bubbles

Food:
It all looked amazing, but they were already sold out of several items at 11:30am & we had just eaten.  We will be back!
author: Christy L.

description:
One of my favorite places in SF. I would give this place 5 stars if there was an area to sit down inside. 

Love the coffee and baked goods. Don't leave without trying their scones and biscuits. Plus in right by the ocean so you can enjoy a beach stroll after. 

There is always I line but it goes by pretty fast (10-15 minutes).
author: annie n.

description: Finally...good coffee in the sunset! If you like blue bottle you will love Andytown. Great coffee with no frills and fresh pastries..Try the blueberry corn muffin!
author: Christine H.

description:
All I had was a latte, but I like fact that they sell 8oz bags of beans. I love the narrow space, the activity, the mini roaster, and the friendly Irish dude roasting in this tiny space. Freshly baked scones and nice timeless latte art round out this joint. Parking is easy, but don't plan on doing work or hanging out here, it's small enough so that the line is out there door if there are more than 5 people on it. 

I wonder if they built the space do they could be known by their seemingly long lines.
author: Heshy F.

description: Beautiful ambiance, friendly service, and the snowy plover is beyond compare. I love the simple outdoor seating, and all of the baked goods! The soda bread toast is one of my favorites, and I like to add the cheese or bacon on top. Love having this place in the sunset!
author: Kira M.

description:
They do everything in-house!
So far I've tried Snowy Plower and some scones. They are all amazing!

Highly recommend snowy plower, which is made with simple ingredients (sparkling water, espresso, syrup and fresh whipped cream) but the combination is just divine :) Thumbs up for fresh house-made whipped cream. AMAZING.
author: Mel C.

description:
Came to SF for the first time this last weekend. Hit all the usual suspects over the course of our stay; bluebottle, ritual, sight glass, and four barrel. Then there was Andytown. Came across them on some webpage I can't remember the name of anymore. Anyway, great small space with a small roasting operation and baking oven in the back. Chatted up the husband/wife owner/barista team, pleasant and welcoming. Latte was solid, chedder/chive scone was great, as well the sausage roll (love the HP). Brought home the Panama offering, and it has performed well in the Aeropress and espresso machine. 
Bottom line, this place stood out, perhaps because I live in a small town and I could identify with their smaller cafe/roastery.
author: Jake C.

description: Love what these folks are doing. Awesome coffee, friendly staff, cool atmosphere and originality. Don't get here as often as I like since it's so far from my house but I really enjoy when I do make it over.
author: Kara S.

description: LOVE love love. The space is absolutely beautiful- full of light and adorned with flowers and cotton. The baristas are consistently friendly and welcoming in a way that feels personable and natural. Baristas take your order directly and make your drinks at the bar before you pay- you get to see the whole process. Impeccable latte art and delicious coffee. Pastries are on par with Tartine and are reasonably priced. They are baked in-house, and the whole place smells like scones in the mornings, it's so lovely. A breakfast for 2 adds up to $12 which is so affordable for the city. Hours are short on weekdays (closing at 3), but thank god it's summer because I will be there undoubtably several times a week. So happy to have discovered this place!
author: Maddy P.

description:
Thank god. 
Great coffee and excellent people serving it.
Welcome to the neighborhood - We're all excited to have you!
author: Lou D.

description: REALLY great coffee. Everything (food or drink) is all around absolutely delicious. That said, Andytown is so much more than coffee. The people are kind and friendly. It's well worth a wait if there's a line because you can chat it up with the baristas/chefs/neighbors extraordinaire.  Everytime I go here there's a lovely sense of neighborly community. And the best coffee. REALLY.
author: K P.

description: Lattes are kinda weak but the coffee is very good and strong. I come here for the muffins though - the straight out of the oven, warm corn and strawberry muffin is the stuff of dreams.
author: Laura Y.

description:
14.00.00       Past Visit
                     Hit & Run review ... will update


Had the Snowy Plover ... it was a unique and tasty experience.

The breads were ok ... kinda pricy
    The MILL by Joey Baker was worth the money

Will try the coffee in the pure form next time
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Very cute and nicely designed coffee corner!

A friend and I decided to come check out the snowy plover. We both agreed that they weren't the best because the coffee was on the sour side, but mixing the cream in made the drink a bit better. I don't think I'll be trying another anytime soon, but I would love to check out the other flavors as they do roast their own coffee.

We also tried a plum mint scone, and it was really good! Fresh from the oven, the scone wasn't too sweet and had the perfect combination of plum and mint.

I appreciate the ample parking around here, making the trip much more pleasant than it could have been. Will definitely come back to try other things!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Quirky. Cute concept. Small hallway of tables connected to the wall, seating 1-2 people. Corner communal table at the front. Near the beach in Sunset. Solid cafe in Sunset that has easy parking.

Soda Farel with cheese and bacon: Manchego cheese with some bacon. Very nice, simple and well done concept.

Cheddar and scallion scone: Great buttery texture, flavor permeates vastly from scallions.

Coffee (gibraltar): Beautiful. Microfoam is done just right, timing is all good, temperature control is great, depth is perfect. Nice and light just the way I like it.

Thank you Andytown, I will be back!
author: Jay C.

description:
How much do I love Andytown? Let me enumerate the ways. Great great coffee, kind proprietors who are sweet to children and can discuss Irish literature, pastries baked on site delicious enough to rival Tartine. Yes I said it. Tartine. 

Back to coffee, it's always back to coffee. I'm a third wave snob, so I usually only drink coffee roasted by hand in antique Probats which was grown in the shade of an ancient baobab tree with a 100 year old yogi living in it and picked by indigenous people in control of their own destinies and who receive hourly reiki massage from the people who work at yelp. 

And yet, even coffee sourced that carefully doesn't come close to the subtle nuances I detect in that which was roasted with such care and love by Michael McCrory and prepared by the Maestra, Lauren Crabbe. Get yourself some. 

Snowy Plover
any scone
espresso
yum
author: Liz B.

description:
on a trip to SF, this was the closest coffee spot to the place we we're staying at. the coffee was great. i love the lattes! the peach and goat cheese corn muffin was AAAAMAAAZZIIINNGGG and i usually dont like corn muffins! also, the cheddar scallion scone was delicious!

the staff was so friendly and the inside had a great aesthetic to it that i wish there was a place like this closer to me.
author: Katrina B.

description:
Maybe now I can stay awake...
We've been eagerly watching the buildout and the big weekend has arrived! Was at opening yesterday- line around the block but they were kind to give me a coffee after I filled a frantic pup's water dish (nice touch to offer doggy drinking dishes). Went back today, line STILL long but so worth the wait. Had a luscious latte that was amazing and *almost* to gorgeous to drink. Thrilled this is steps from my house. Hope they add more outside seating. Can't wait to try the Irish soda bread. 

Welcome to the 'hood!!
author: LivMusic L.

description:
I have been to my fair share of independent roasters and Andytown definitely impressed me! Located in the Outer Sunset it brings a hipster style but friendly and welcoming service. There was a bit of a line when we came but since parking was so easy we decided to try it out! The line goes faster than it looks, it is mostly long on account for how tiny the place is. 

They serve your standard brewed espresso drinks but also an interesting drink called the Snowy Plover - a coffee soda would be the best way to describe it! I also was a rebel and tried their hot cocoa. 
You can opt for a fresh whipped cream to go with your drinks :)

I loved that they have a select variety of baked items as well, all huge and yummy. We tried four different baked goods including my favorite the Peach and Goat Cheese corn muffing along with Blueberry corn muffin, chocolate scone and cherry scone. 

I appreciated their friendly service and really great value considering all we ordered! Will definitely be back :)
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
Went to finally check out the newest coffee shop in my neighborhood today and I'm so glad I did. I think it's my new favorite. Friendly service, in-house baked goods and most importantly, good coffee. Their strawberry corn muffin had just come out of the oven, so I tried one of those and it was huge and delicious. I also bought one of their sausage rolls and it was warm and filling. 

I'm so happy that new businesses are opening up in the Outer Sunset! Oh, also they take credit cards unlike some other businesses in our area. :)
author: vicki c.

description: Is there anything better than a slightly overcast, blustery ocean breeze afternoon in the Outer Sunset District of San Francisco? If it hadn't been so early I probably would have opted for a Guinness at a local pub, but I chose a little pick me up and a scone instead. The Snowy Plover ($4), named after a bird, is a specialty coffee of Andytown that I have read about in numerous publications but ran across most recently in a Bold Italic article. Sparkling water, a little simple syrup, espresso over ice, and topped with a house made whipped cream scoop makes a beverage that looks and tastes as smooth as Guinness. I wholeheartedly recommend coming by and trying this unique take on an americano. The soda current scone ($2.75??) I purchased was outstanding as well. Although the shop isn't large enough to set up shop for a work or study session, there is some outside seating for you to enjoy until the traffic cops come sweeping through. Just a reminder, don't park on the street from noon till 2 the 1st and 3rd Friday of the month!
author: Temo B.

description:
It's awesome place!!  Finally we have hippy cafe in Outer Sunset!
Cheddar scone is soooo good!!
author: Sujin L.

description:
For someone who works at a coffee shop, I have to admit, this has become my favorite coffee shop. I've made it a point to come here almost every weekend, dragging my boyfriend along (he can vouch how much I love this place). 

Environment- So cute and simple. The clean white walls/shelves/counters are nicely accented with fresh flowers and plants sprinkled throughout. There's nice tiny seating both in and out which suits the cafe. I love that they have dog treats in front. 

Food/Drink - I love love LOVE their sausage rolls, if only they made them every day. :( Their fresh fruit muffins are also amazing, the strawberry corn muffin fresh out of the oven is hard to beat. The boyfriend goes with either the cheddar scallion scone or the wheat bread with raw cheddar and bacon. They serve them on little wooden boards if they are "for here" which is wonderful. Their latte's are perfectly foamed and the art is exquisite. You can tell the owners care a lot about their craft. I will have to echo that you MUST try the Snowy Plover. Perfectly carbonated, caffeinated and sweet. Their homemade whipped cream is to die for.

Service - AMAZING. They are all extremely welcoming. 

**I do love that they use Square because I never have cash on me, and I can tip them through my card.
author: Darline D.

description:
5 stars for fast and friendly service, snowy plover, latte, and goat cheese scones, cleanliness, and close proximity to the beach! 

First time here, and definitely not my last. I'm bringing all my friends!
author: Han N.

description: Needed a good pick me up before I take a ride thru ggp ... Told them I needed a caffeine boost they suggested the Gibraltar... Off menu order eyes widened after the first sip... Lol.. Love places like this...
author: Rey M.

description:
The place is new and small but has a very welcoming feeling and environment.  Anytown's coffee beans smells great with nice perfectly blended taste.  
Drip or espresso they do great coffee!!!
author: Philip W.

description: Habits are fulfilled with quality here. They nailed the location, the food, the drinks. Been here a few times and each time I ordered something different. Not surprisingly  every item is great. My choices in life are now to buy a really expensive espresso machine, learn to bake, buy only premium beans, or just come here. Better to lease than buy some times nah mean ?
author: Crypto M.

description:
UPDATE: They are open longer now (until 5pm), yay! They also have GF pastries now.. yayayayayay!!! They are seriously the nicest humans ever- everyone who works here is. 

over a year ago:
Live across the street- they're incredibly kind and will treat you like a human being worth their time AND serve you a delicious latte. I say latte because that's the only thing I've tried- normally don't even drink them, but I went in before they opened and they gave me a latte ON THE HOUSE. It tasted so fresh and delicious that I definitely will keep ordering them.
author: Megan M.

description: I love this place and am so happy they are so close to home!  I don't get anything fancy, just an almond milk latte, but it is the best!  Have to get a strawberry chocolate scone when they have it!  My sister reached out to see if she could do a special order of them, and they were so sweet to accommodate!  Make sure to get there before 11am on the weekends so you don't miss out!  Their corn muffins are also great!  My personal favorite is the blueberry corn muffin which they sometimes make with peach!  All I can say is love love love!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Great coffee (and tea)! Great service. And a great location.

Infinitely prefer this to Trouble coffee. Also, they have a menu.
author: John C.

description: Funny enough, I am NOT a fan of sparkling water or whipped cream individually and I can barely stand to drink an americano, but put all of these things together and bam! I'm a huge fan! I love their snowy plovers and their service is always on point. Unfortunately there's not a whole lot of space to sit - a few wall tables and a communal table at the front - but who needs to sit down when you can walk across the street to the beach!
author: Jamie B.

description: Welcoming, clean and FRIENDLY staff:) Fresh pastries baked in house, roasted coffee in house and topped off with beautifully design flower arrangements.  Highly recommend their signature drink... Snowy plover:)
author: Corrine N.

description: My favorite coffee place in San Francisco. Not only are their Americano's delicious but also properly priced ( I think 2.75). The Snowy Plover is a creation of theirs where they make a version of a Coffee Float using homemade whipped cream. At the end of the day, this place is the shit, just do it. (Also everyone who works here is an absolute sweetheart)
author: Noah S.

description: As I came in here on a Tuesday afternoon, I was greeted by a crowd of people and smiling baristas who clearly loved their jobs. Besides the delightful coffee shop music and the amazing drip coffee what I loved about this place the most was the adorable decor! There are wall seats you can study at. It looks a little cramped at first but there's definitely enough room for your laptop and ya cup of joe. There's seating near the door but it's typically a little more crowded over there from my personal experience. Overall I will definitely be coming back here! (most likely on a weekday though. I assume it gets pretty busy on the weekends. Especially if I plan on getting some work done)
author: Leah C.

description: Super cool baristas in a very laid back outer sunset district. They made me a cortado which was really nice and smooth.
author: Sudeep G.

description: I found this place online when I thought I was in a coffee desert and it has become my go-to on the weekends pre or post Lands End. It is awesome. Their coffee is delicious and their baked goods are insane. My daughter loves the corn + fruit option they have and will clutch the bag as she falls asleep. I love pretty much everything I've tried, especially the cream currant scone. Wonderful place, definitely worth standing in the line.
author: Ruchi M.

description:
All I can say is YEAH!  This place is amazing.  The coffee the baked goods.
The sunset's new gem.
author: Alicia H.

description: Getting parking here is fantastic. They don't offer any pourover coffee so I opted for one of their drips, I forget the name of the bean and roast, but it was their in house blend. The drip coffee tasted like every other drip I've had. It was over extracted, which makes an overly bitter cup, had a tar feeling that stuck to my tongue. I bought a bag of beans to see if I could work with them at home. The beans were roasted dark, but not so dark that the bean was oily. They could specialize in espresso and I'm not as versed in that, so I would definitely check it out if you're an espresso aficionado just in case. The workers are incredibly nice and the interior of the store is quant and homey. I would give it a chance again just because of the interaction I had with the workers and the parking situation is amazing for the city.
author: Nick F.

description: A simply wonderful place in San Francisco to get a cup of coffee and a scone.
author: John H.

description:
A walk in the neighborhood and we stumbled in upon this gem.  Beautiful clean, modern interior and design choices, without being stuffy, pretentious, or Hard.  A lovely large burlwood table, fantastic personable service.  And Holy cow, the brown bread (wheaten bread) is just like in Ireland.  Irish soda bread with cheese and bacon was fresh and beautifully textured.  Like they say in Ireland:   "Mmmm That's Gorgeous". I'd heard that the recipe for the soda bread is the owner's grandmother's from Belfast.  
Coffee was roasted right there in the shop, with adorable hearts made in the foam.  The tea was quality and delicious.  I can't even begin to say how charmed and delighted I am to have found it.  I hope it sticks around a long time and becomes an icon of coffee awesomeness in this part of the city.
author: Amelia H.

description:
I was visiting my friend who lives in SF and we heard this place was amazing, so we decided to check it out. 

The snowy plover was as good as people say. I am not a surgery coffee drinks fan but I felt like this specialty coffee drink had just the right amount of sweet mixed with quality coffee. Next time I might ask them to put a tad less brown sugar in the drink to make the flavor of coffee override the sweet. 

As for the breakfast sandwiches - better make sure you're there early. We arrived at 10:30 and they were all sold out. :-(
author: Elizabeth A.

description: I love the espresso here, but I must be the only person who does not like the Snowy Plover. Ah well. I tried it on a hot day last month, and I found it to be too cloying. I'll just be sticking to their reliably excellent cappuccinos and lattes from here on out. On a gluten-free note, apparently their corn muffins ARE gluten-free, as I learned from my friend with Celiac who runs her own GF bread business. Woot! Swing by after the mid-morning rush because long lines are for suckers.
author: Patricia D.

description: Andytown Coffee Roasters is my favorite coffee shop in the city (and I'm not just saying that because it's conveniently located in my lovely Outer Sunset neighborhood.) Excellent coffee, great customer service and the best scones you will ever have (baked from scratch in-house daily.) Small establishment so any line means there's a line out the door, but I think that accurately reflects how great of a spot it is.
author: Ellie A.

description: Always willing to make the drive out here when I'm craving a snowy plover! Everyone who works here is super nice and friendly, very welcoming little coffee shop :) Always a good excuse to come out here to pick up some fresh beans and some coffee. Baked stuff are also tasty and worth the splurge.
author: Maryann S.

description: Best mocha on Earth! Cool space and staff and vibe.
author: Adam F.

description: Definitely give the snowy plover a chance. Oh-so-unique and tasty!
author: Bree G.

description: Owned by an Irish expat, this friendly caf has top notch espressos. They even produce their own bread, which generally comes with seasonal spreads. The pumpkin spread I've had for Halloween was perfect!
author: Carolina V.

description: Had a snowy plover and a strawberry corn muffin. Both were totally rad and inventive! A little overcast and windy today but their outdoor seating was still a great spot to post up and read some comics on a day off.
author: Josh F.

description: I wish sfgate never wrote an article about this place.  Now my favorite coffee shop is inundated with customers.  Been going here close to when they first opened.  Great coffee, fresh pastries, and soda bread.  Love their iced mocha, it's strong enough espresso flavor with balance, not too acidic or bitter. Haven't found a better place in the city.
author: Dorothy W.

description: This place is amazing! I had it for the first time a few days ago. It smells good, and is a cute little coffee shop. Thank you to my friends boyfriend for taking her there, so she told me about it. :)
author: Noelle D.

description: I am so glad there is another great coffee shop in the Outer Sunset. I love the fresh muffins -- I'm sitting here eating a hot-out-of-the-oven peach blueberry corn muffin as I type this, and it's perfect! Service is very friendly, decor is right on, and the drinks are done just right. Great work, everyone at Andytown - you're fast becoming a new neighborhood staple!
author: Toby B.

description: Excellent! I was introduced to this place by my sister. She told me about the snowy plover and I thought it was a really weird combination. However I couldn't I seem to get the idea outta my mind so I trekked my way here on a Friday afternoon and ordered their infamous drink. Much to my surprise, it was delicious! Tastes better and better with each sip. I've read from the other reviews that their lattes are also really good so I will have to try that next. Definitely recommend if you are in the area!
author: Bonnie D.

description: Best Cofee visit I had in SF but perhaps one of the more memorable drinks. I love this place and Now I will be visiting this place more often with my Girlfriend.
author: Ahmad T.

description: The cutest coffeeshop of ALL TIME. Also, they invented a new type of coffee. It's essentially a root beer float, except with coffee instead of root beer, and if they said that I think we'd all be a little less enthralled by the concept, but eh. It's very good! (Also, it seemed a bit sweet to me! I wonder if they put in sugar along with the pellegrino.)
author: Grant M.

description:
I have lived in the formerly dreary Sunset District for years and never envisioned that a place as lovely as Andytown would set up shop here. It is beautiful and bright, even on a foggy summer day. The espresso is excellent, the prices on par with other fancy coffee spots around town and the service is kind and friendly. I love the little touches, such as shot glass of mineral water that comes with your drink. Welcome!
I have ot tried them in the morning so I do not know how their service would hold up against rushed employees. I hope that, some day, they will extend their hours past two. I like a 4PM espresso.
author: jessica d.

description: My favorite SF coffee shop, how lucky am I that it's in my neighborhood?! Beans roasted fresh, great drinks (including tea), wonderful baked goods including gluten free corn muffins, friendly staff and sweet owners who know their coffee. Plus locally made goods and coffee accessories. There's outdoor seating too. Definitely try the snowy plover (I like it half sweet), and whatever just came out of the oven.
author: mona r.

description: Such a cute little coffee shop. It's tiny but has outdoor seatings, which is always a plus in the city. I tried the iced mocha with homemade whip cream on top, and it was bitter and didn't taste quite right. It seemed like they were training someone, so it's all good! :) Then I tried my friend's hot mocha and whoa, the best! I've got to try their snowy plovers next time.
author: Sara S.

description: Delicious muffins! The coffee isn't my favorite- a few times it's been sour tasting, but I'm just happy to have a coffee shop with a nice vibe, great pastries, and decent coffee in my neck of the woods :)
author: Nicole N.

description: Now I feel like I understand what "third-wave" coffee really is. All I had was a latte but I swear it was the best latte I've ever had. It was creamy from start to finish with such a pleasant roastiness and just enough sweetness... I never wanted it to end! Their prices are pretty up there but it was worth it for top notch quality. The interior is really quaint but really small. It's not really situated for people to sit and hang out, which is a bummer because I wanted to hang out at least for a little bit to read and try one of their pastries which made my mouth water just looking at them. The people who work there are really sweet as well! I definitely will return for more when I feel like spending a little more and treating myself.
author: Serena C.

description:
I visited Andytown twice, the first time I got a latte - pretty good but regular latte to me, and the second time I got its famous Snowy Plover. I love Snowy Plover. At first I thought it was an odd combo - sparkling water and coffee???!!! - but I really like iced coffee so I went ahead and gave it a try. I love Snowy Plover. The only complaint I have is, that delicious whip cream takes too much space in the cup so the real liquid with ice I really have is about 1/2 of its 12oz cup. I have to be really careful and drink super slow for the ice to melt to get more liquid. What I'm trying to say is, I was not satisfied. How can they make something so delicious but so small and yet so expensive ($4) that I do not allow myself to buy two cups at a time (no large cup option, I don't think)? So mean.
I've tried its cookies, and for $1.75 per cookie, they really are just ok. But I will try its soda bread next time I'm in town cuz it seems to be most people's favorites.
Parking sucks (but it does everywhere in Sunset) and the place is small if you want to enjoy your coffee/ pastry there, and although the line is always out the door, the wait is not so bad.
author: HsuMeow L.

description: My boyfriend is a huge fan of coffee so I decided to go on Yelp. The ambience felt so peaceful and relaxing. Good vibes all around. We decided to try the Snowy Plover since everyone recommended it. I'm not a huge fan of coffee but this drink was definitely something else. It's definitely an interesting try. I recommend this place!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I stumbled upon this place this morning for the first time, what a treat! I was searching for a place to grab a bite, a beverage with a kick, and somewhere to get a little work done. I read the other reviews on yelp before heading out of the house.  The Snowy Plover was more amazing than I had imagined.... I had two! I paired it with a jalapeño corn scone that was so soft, moist, and savory! So happy to have found this gem! 
Since I came alone I grabbed on of the small bar height tables on the side of the shop. It was a bit smaller work space than what I was expecting, but once I got cozy I was able to find focus amidst the buzz of Sunday mid-morning rush.
author: Rebecca M.

description: The Snowy Plover is totally delicious. I was a little skeptical about mixing Pelegrino and coffee flavors, but it totally works. I also tried their Irish soda bread farl (i.e. fourth), which I've never had before, and I really really liked it. It's served warm and buttered and tastes great on a cold Outer Sunset morning.
author: Jacob R.

description: They've stepped it back up to amazing- the slower server doesn't seem to work there any longer and it's once again doable for me to go before work! Thank you!!!
author: Barbara S.

description:
Yea, it is THAT good. Any establishment with a line out the door is always a good sign. I've had their famous Snowy Plover (try it), Almond milk Lattes (mm so good) and their freshly made scones.

DELICIOUS!
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: I'll drive ten minutes in the wrong direction for this place.  I love starting Saturday morning with a quad espresso and a strawberry corn muffin.  I wished they opened a bit earlier, but it's worth the wait.
author: Tom M.

description: Almond milk latte is addicting...so smooth and delicious! Most of the breakfast treats I've tried are top notch, but my favorite is the cheddar scallion scone.  It's more like a savory biscuit, but it is pretty amazing! Thankful for this simple, but amazing little spot!
author: Monica L.

description: Wow. This place really hits the spot on a June gloom type of day. I had a fresh scallions and cheese scone and just seemed to melt in my mouth. I also tried the strawberry corn muffin, which was moist and delicious. I would also highly recommend the snowy plover. It's like a Italian soda but espresso style. My only kick back would be that it can be a bit constraining on your wallet.
author: E C.

description: YES!!  The snowy plover is  a must. Apricot scones, nice breads and very friendly, fun staff.
author: Cliodhna R.

description: Came here one week day morning with a friend because she raved about their great pastries. When we arrived there was a line to the door (which moved pretty well). The staff was very friendly and chatty. I ended up ordering my standard latte and a gluten free peach cornbread muffin with a raspberry jam center. The latte was great, but what really hit a home run was the muffin. It was so moist and soft and had decent sized chunks of fresh peaches inside (so delicious and flavorful) and the jam center added a fun other flavor to compliment the peach. I'm pretty much a sucker for anything raspberry, so needless to say I devoured it. A lot of their other pastries looked great too, as they were all very creative combinations of flavors. My friend ordered the toast with jam and the bread it came with was so thick and fresh, it was toast perfection. Great job Andytown!
author: Kylie B.

description: This is my go to coffee place in the city.  They also have the best cookies, scones and muffins!  Java Beach and Trouble are much closer, but I rather go to Andytown.  They have the friendliest staff too.  I only wish they opened earlier so I can get my fix in the morning.  Already recommended them to all my friends.
author: Michelle D.

description: Good heavens!! I got a kale, red onion, garlic, red chili pepper flake scone with lemon pepper ricotta. Has a nice light spice kick to it. Best savory pastry I've ever had!!!
author: Ashley M.

description: Got the snowy plover and loved it! So refreshing. You can get the regular snowy plover with hand-made whipped cream, or you can opt for almond milk if you like. I will definitely be coming back again and again.
author: Margaret W.

description: Quality house roasted coffee and house baked creations. All in the sleepy outer Sunset. Despite it's remote locale, this place is a rightfully sought out destination for the neighborhood locals and visitors alike. Plenty of out door seating alleviates the snug interior. Charming decor, bright, clean, and modern with a touch of rugged outer Sunset beach vibe. Coffee paraphanellia and dish ware on display for sale. Fiercely creative floral arrangements. Srsly. Roasting oven in rear. Roasting days are siren calls for caffeine fix whether you want it or not. Killer apps are the soda bread, any daily pastry specials, aaaand the Snowy Plover. OMG. Refreshing and delish, and worth getting even on cold, foggy days (almost everyday). Get it with the house whipped cream. Eff your diet.
author: E. W.

description: Yes, yes, yes! Everything about this place is perfect, from the coffee drinks (helllllo, Snowy Plover) to the best pastries (literally the best corn muffins ever) to the super-friendly staff to the background music (Jacques Dutronc? Oui oui!).
author: Dan S.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop in the city hands down. The coffee is phenomenal, great atmosphere, great people. I would come here everyday if I could. Pastries also delicious.
author: Mackenzie A.

description:
Andytown is one of THE BEST coffee shops in the entire city. My girlfriend and I love coming here on a Saturday or Sunday morning for a quick brunch stop. We've probably been 15-20 times in the past 2 years and will continue to keep coming (even though she doesn't live in the Sunset anymore!). 

Highlights:
- $2.50 cup of coffee! Phenomenal! You can bring your own mug in as well, but in this day and age of charging minimum $3 for an 8oz cup of coffee, Andytown is not sticking the price on the coffee drinker who enjoys a good cup of coffee. 
- Delicious food! We usually go for the Soda Farl with Cheddar and Bacon, and then we get one of the pastries that they have just taken out of the oven - just ask which one is the freshest out of the oven and it'll still be warm....mmmm.
- Awesome, awesome service. I can't stress this enough - Andytown is so popular the line is usually out the door and stays that way for hours on end. With such high demand, it might be easy to just focus on your job and not be pleasant - this is NOT the case at Andytown. The entire team is right in front of you, working really hard but also being charming during your entire visit!
- $1 refill. For us coffee addicts, the $1 refill is awesome!

All in all, I have nothing but good things to say about Andytown. We were there just a few days ago and can't wait to come back!
author: Zack C.

description:
This is the best coffee shop in San Francisco!  I'm a Ritual fan and always was when I lived in San Francisco, but upon a recent trip back to the bay, I discovered Andytown and fell in love!!  
The staff is warm and friendly, the inside is small and cozy, but well lit and bright. The outside seating is beautiful and the neighborhood feels nice and calm. You're also super close to the beach! 
The Italian style machiatto was wonderfully smooth, my Gibraltar/Cortado was also nice too and my special latte with their sweet syrup they use to make the Snowy Plover drinks was wonderful. The roast os a perfeft balance of full and rich but not too dark. Perfect balance. 
They also have house made whip which is glorious!  The staff was ao wonderful. Patient with me and my son and cleaning up the hot chocolate we spilled ALL OVER the inside table. This place in a true jem It's my new favorite coffee joint in Califronia!!
author: Elise H.

description: kudos to the pastry chef, coffee not bad either, the young mom behind the counter excellent, baristas efficient and pros ... quiet working environs, and lines like you missed when waiting for Jaws at the old Coronet ... alas vibe reminds me alot like a jaycee in and out ... but when you drop your laptop, unplug yourself take a seat and feel your surroundings you can get so much more than a cup of coffee and get sconed while doing it!
author: tim y.

description: Yay! I'm a fan.  Nice location and vibe.  The coffee was great but place was a bit too small.  However, the place really captures the essence of SF and the neighborhood.  The Snowy Plover seems to be a popular drink but doesn't live up to the hype but I'd go there again for the coffee.
author: Eric H.

description: Always has been, and always will be the best coffee in SF. Peerless coffee, food, service, and atmosphere. Andytown offers nothing but a consistent 5 star experience that I'd recommend to anyone.
author: Ramy S.

description:
Man this place is amazing.

Great coffee, UNBELIEVABLY great baked goods, friendly & open atmosphere, outdoor seating, what more can you ask for!?

I'll be back again and again, and then - again. We are so lucky to have a place that puts this kind of care into their products. Andytown, please keep doing it!!!
author: Jon B.

description: Came across this place on accident and so glad I did.  The coffee was excellent and the bakery selections were fresh and unique.  Will definitely come back!
author: Rodney M.

description: Decent latte, average coffee, good baked goods. Overall not bad, but also certainly not as good as the perpetual line would warrant.
author: Trim W.

description: I really love this little spot. It has a really nice esthetic but without the feeling of being to cool and self indulgent. The people are ALWAYS really friendly and the owner is a lovely person. My boyfriend and I come here to work even though it's small because it is so pleasant and they play nice soft music that is nice to work to.
author: Tess B.

description: I love this place! The first time, I tried their infamous snowy plover, it's essentially a coffee soda but so delish. I'm don't usually like whipped cream but their homemade whip cream makes the drink! They offer a variety of muffins, cookies, and scones. Their service is amazing, they accidently forgot my latte, so the barista kindly made my latte and gave me a free chocolate cookie. Definitely will go back and try more of their muffins.
author: Jessica Z.

description: never had soda bread before here and loved it! small place and the line is a bit much so don't go unless you are planning on waiting in a line and possible not going to sit.
author: Samantha R.

description:
Nothing like fresh baked irish soda bread in the ocean breeze. The snowy plover was amazing. Also the bathroom was really nice.

Watched other people enjoy their food and drinks, wanted to try everything.
author: Laini H.

description: This place is amazing. I've been here twice and have had a good experience both times. I got the snowy plover and the mocha, both are delicious and are of good quality. I also got the cheese scallion scone both times and it is incredibly good, especially when you get it fresh out of the oven. Although there is always a line, the wait for your order is never too long. I think i've waited about five minutes to get my drink and my scone. The servers there are also very friendly as well. I wish I had known about this place sooner as it is only a five minute drive from my home. Will definitely be coming back to this place!
author: Austin C.

description: My BF and I stopped in to get some coffee and hot chocolate to go. It took us a while to find a coffee joint but we came up on this one and figured we'd give it a shot. The wait wasn't too bad and we decided to go simple since we needed to get back home. Both of us felt that our drinks were somewhat lackluster. It's a cute place and I do wish we would have tried some of the food items but I think for coffee or the hot chocolate were both a little on the meh side.
author: Shauna S.

description:
The espressos here are fantastic. I've tried it decaf as well and it's not bad. 

They also roast their own coffee beans here. My favorite is the Ethiopian Yirgacheffe for normal drip coffee. I use their Colombian for cold brew because they roast it slightly  darker. 

The store hours are limited right now but if you're in the Sunset it's probably the best coffee you can get. Trouble Coffee is a close second.
author: Anthony H.

description: Yup. These guys are awesome. Their Kees van see Westen lever machine comes from the MoMa. Having a local coffee bar that actually knows what their doing is super valuable to me, living in the 'Set. Meet you there.
author: Hodie K.

description: Fantastic coffee tasting experience and awesome fresh bake scone. I would like to start my every happy day from here.
author: Chih Hao Y.

description: Great little place, the Snowy Plower is as good as everyone says it is. Scones are also quite excellent. Right on the corner with a modern but homey feeling. Wish there were more seating inside but understandable in this neighborhood.
author: Ken C.

description: If you want amazing coffee and amazing people and staff, go here. The best coffee shop in the city, hands down.
author: Stefani O.

description: Love this newish roastery! Great cappucino and loved the hearty brown bread with cheddar and bacon on top. It was copious and just thing I needed before a windy Sunday motorcycle ride up Mt. Tam. Andytown - I will be back!
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description: Andytown has become one of our family's favorite places to go. The snowy plover never disappoints and their home brewed coffee/house-baked scones make the experience unforgettable. The staff is incredibly friendly providing a homey feel to the already perfect environment!
author: Kim W.

description: A welcome addition to Outer Sunset! Lovely staff, lovely baked goods and lovely coffee. Snowy Plover was unique and delicious. Baked goodies come right out of their little oven onto their front counter. On our particular visit they had blackberry corn muffins and cheddar scallion scones. Incredible! There is a small communal table inside and several small tables and chairs along the side of the shop. Can't wait to stop by again.
author: Lisa H.

description: Probably the best coffee experience I've had in America. The owner made my mocha, and did the cashiering, all the while  chatting us up as we drooled over his craftsmanship. I'm not a coffee drinker really but this was wonderful, and the sausage pastry was sensational. Andytown FTW!!
author: Danny K.

description: I cannot stop thinking about the Snowy Plover! Why oh why has no one thought of this delightful creation before! A caffeine fix meets a refreshing beverage. It is a fabulous creation of bubbly water, espresso, simple syrup topped with homemade whipped cream. If you are within an hour drive, trust me it is worth your while to make your way to this coffee spot. And because I cannot make up my mind and have a coffee addiction I also enjoyed a mocha which was divine. They offer baked goods as well, I tried the two cookies they had to offer. Trust me when I say this spot us worth the drive to the Sunset!
author: Victoria O.

description:
I was a few minutes early in picking up a friend one weekday morning in the Outer Sunset and had about 10 minutes to kill. Since I didn't make enough time to brew my morning coffee, I decided finding a local coffee spot would do the trick. And boy did Andytown not disappoint.

Unless I decide to be fun along the lines of something in the latte family, my everyday coffee is black. Because I was in a rush, I went for the already brewed coffee, and was very surprised by how delightful it was as I sipped the drink. Notes of citrus and fall spices came through on the nose and in the aftertaste.  I love when you can actually taste layers of flavor that hit you at different moments when drinking a good cup of coffee, and this certainly had that. 

There was also a stunning and very tempting display of pastries right in front and in hindsight I wish that I grabbed one to go with me out the door- they looked DIVINE.

I love coffee shops and their general cozy vibe, but between you and me, I'm tired of coffee shops feeling like musty old witch dens. Something very refreshing about Andytown's decor is the bright use of color and tall ceilings. Although a fairly narrow space, the white subway tiles make it brighter and clean looking. A very kind staff as well - always appreciated as a customer.

I can't wait to find another excuse to make it back and try a pastry, and of course drink more of that delicious coffee.
author: A. P.

description: Their cappuccino is not bad ... it's nice and strong . However , it comes in a pretty small cup and they only have one size. I don't like their snow plower or baked goods ...tastes weird to me. The  baristas take their time to make drinks so it might take a while to get your coffee. I love that their bathroom is super clean. I also love the fact that there's plenty of parking by this coffee shop.
author: Eileen L.

description: Delightful soda bread muffins and delicious cappuccinos. The space is small but there's plenty of seating outside, in my opinion better. Lovely baristas, too!
author: Jeri M.

description: Update: I had an instant crush on Andytown when I first discovered them and now I'm in LOVE! My husband and I have one day off together and that day is Monday, the only day Andytown is closed :-( I'm seriously thinking of changing my days off so we can make Andytown part of our day off together routine! The snowy plover is my new favorite thing in life and I look forward to it all week, seriously. I work crazy hours and on my days off I could/should sleep all day but set my alarm so I can get to Andytown before they close at 3pm for my snowy plover and house made bread/cheese/bacon sandwich for breakfast. I've tried the scones and they are the best I've ever had but that bread with cheese and bacon...ahhhh.... best breakfast and hangover cure. Yay Andytown.
author: S. C.

description: A wonderful and welcomed addition to the Sunset. With stiff competition for coffee roasters in SF, I am skeptical when hearing of new people putting there hats into that ring, but was impressed with the quality and put my cappuccino up their with some of the best in the city. The cafe was also nicely designed and reminded me of cafés I would go to when I lived in Berlin. Also note to mention, they were playing The Clash and not some crappy cafe music. I don't know these people and was skeptical before I went, but was pleasantly surprised and welcome the great addition to the neighborhood. Only complaint, Longer hours and a saucer for your drink when you are drinking in the cafe, to easy to spill with out one (which I did).
author: dub g.

description: This coffee place has opened up just by my house recently and I decided to try it. I tried the iced mocha with fresh whipped cream. It did not "wow" me but it was decent. But I will most definitely come back for the snowy plower. I wasn't going for a lot of sweet that day so I opted out of it. The place is really nice and new. The little baked good looked delicious as well.
author: Allie B.

description: Cortado, was not so great. Espresso was a little bitter and the foam a bit bubbly. The snowy plover, however, to die for.
author: Crystal F.

description: Seems redundant to post another 5 star review - but oh well, it's fun :)  Dropped in today with middling expectations and walked out totally delighted.  Inside is light and beachy (perfect for the sunset), the customers were happy and had kids and dogs with them (which I enjoy), the coffee menu was easy to understand, my cappuccino was delicious, my partner's "snowy plover" sparkling iced coffee was a tasty treat, and our chocolate cherry scone was warm and basically perfect.  This place is well worth a trip out, and definitely can't miss it if you're a sunset dweller.  We'll be back soon!  And we are hoping the hours get extended so we can come even more often.
author: Ani H.

description: As if their Sausage Rolls and Regular coffee wasn't enough to earn them 5 stars, the Snowy Plover seals the deal. My new favorite coffee spot in the Outer Sunset!
author: Eric L.

description: Amazing people; amazing food; amazing coffee. If I could afford it, I would go at least three to four times a day. The coffee is amazing. The sausage rolls are to kill for (but please note that you need to get to the shop EARLY to be able to grab one). Actually, as all their pastries and breads are made from scratch - they are awesome. And the freshly roasted beans (roasted every Monday) make me look like an erudite coffee snob. If you haven't been there and want a tasty cup of joe with some really nice folks, you have to go to Andytown.
author: Abe L.

description: I am addicted to this place. I was about to go out to the beach and get one of their decaf mochas with the heavenly whipped cream, but alas they close at 5pm!  I have had their lattes and iced drinks. All are amazing. Also they have wonderful pasties including gluten free ones. I had this raspberry, corn muffin with fresh apricot preserves in the middle that just made the last visit better. It's small, but there are seats outside.
author: karen h.

description: Delicious coffee. And strawberry corn muffins. And cheesy onion scones. WOW. The barista is really tall. You should probably go out of your way to get coffee here.
author: Megan S.

description: I've yet to try the creamy deliciousness that is the well-named snowy plover. Everyone raves about it though. I'm strictly a drip coffee or sometimes nonfat Cappucino drinker. These kind and cheerful folks have those down with fantastic flavored roasted beans. Their muffins are also worth the drive and run, which is becoming a well worn tradition. Drive a couple blocks away, park and secure the car, run down to great highway, to sloat blvd, back to Judah or Lincoln, and up to andytown! It's usually a worthy end to a fun run.
author: Ron W.

description: Awesome space - someone named Stephen was super helpful too which made my time there that much better! I will be back and spreading the word of this yummy coffee and awesome staff!
author: Em O.

description: This is the best place... Everything, and I said everything is great in this place, I want one of each every time I went. I recommend it to anyone who love greatness... the coffee is excellent, creative, the sausage roll is a must try...
author: Franck V.

description:
Excellent coffee!!! House roasted, great aroma and body without the burnt taste so many roasters have.  House baked goods are off the wall!  Blueberry corn muffins, chocolate shortbread, scones....oh and let's not forget Michael's famous soda bread!  

Friendly atmosphere, excellent prices!!! Lauren and Michael (owners) make the best wife/husband team!
author: Maureen R.

description: Andytown is far and away my favorite coffee-shop in the Outer Sunset. Friendly, welcoming staff, great espresso, and delicious baked goods (sausage roll is a treat, though toast with jam is a good everyday option). Located in a great spot that avoids the Outerlands-Trouble weekend crush yet is still a short walk from the Judah corridor (and my house!).
author: Ben S.

description: Everything about Andytown is superb! The service - even when they are busy, you feel at home; they aren't afraid to get to know their customers and actually talk to you. The coffee - A+. It's delicious and made with passion you can taste! The handmade ceramic coffee mugs add to the experience. The food - AMAZING! All the recipes are authentic and feel and taste homemade! Basically, when you come to Andytown, you have a cozy experience filled with the best coffee and baked goods you can find in San Francisco!
author: Billy K.

description: LOOOOOOVE Andytown!! Great coffee, fantastic food (their scones are my favorites!) and everyone who works there is fantastic! So happy to have them in our neighborhood! Thank you Michael and Lauren!
author: Richard B.

description:
Good coffee, great quality. Cute lil place, needs more seating, community table though gorgeous, does not function well.
Need more sizes for iced drinks, I want a big fat huge Iced latte, heck im american and it is my right dammit ;), but seriously, cant stand not having options. Im a big boy and my iced drink is half done before i walk out the door , before i get to work. 

also, do not like that there is no vanilla or caramel. Look, i get it, its coffee, you wannabe super duper elite coffee, not starbucks, heck not peets, but check it-give the people they want. If im going to put sugar in my coffeee then why the f cant i put some vanilla, or caramel or chocolate or whatever.
I think we get your vision, but losing customers over a simple syrup is pretty lame.
get some vanilla, hell hand craft that sh*t  if you need to, make the caramel on an open flame and drizzle that shizzle into me cup of joe dammit. I want it, gotta have it.

Just give customers options, dont be another attitude 'we know what is best for you' Troubled coffee.

Corn muffin is the bomb-even w/o gluten.
many coffee shops came before and didnt make it in this spot, give choices, options, make it good and welcoming and you might last awhile.

Dont get me wrong, coffee is very excellente, i just want a tad more.
rock it!
author: Mel S.

description: Recently visited this coffee shop for the first time. I've heard about their popular "Snowy Plover" iced coffee drink. I decided to try it out and was immediately ill. Severe heartburn, gagging, almost throwing up. I'm thinking maybe the cream was bad? Not sure. If I go back, I'll definitely focus on a latte or other hot coffee drink.
author: Corinne K.

description: Got lucky this morning and found Andytown was just opening its doors.  Great spot with a bright, natural wood and white tile interior...and lots of gleaming espresso and coffee machinery.  You can tell this is a place serious about its coffee.  But, not SO serious that I felt unwelcome.  Sat at the big communal table and chatted with the super friendly owners.  A no-attitude spot with a welcoming Outer Sunset vibe.  And the coffee?  Had a rich and creamy cap...as good as anything I've had before.  Go here.
author: Pat M.

description: Andytown makes one feel that they have stepped into a coffee bar from across the pond, but with City sensibilities.  Friendly, welcoming staff, wonderful interior, great coffee and brilliant authentic Irish soda scones!  A perfect addition to the Sunset and know it will become part of my routine.
author: Erica C.

description: Andytown is finally finished and wow, what a beaut!! The motif of the place, alone, should be incentive to check it out-lots of light and an earthy yet clean design makes it a delight just to be hanging out in. They have WiFi and fresh baked goods that they make on a constant rotation. The place smelled like cinnamon and chocolate! The espresso was delicious and I ended up staying for over an hour just people watching and listening to the pleasant asides and jokes that the staff were making. Love it!!
author: Colby J.

description:
Top-notch coffee, which is of course the foundation of any good coffee shop. Their drip coffee is great, and we've tried their beans for home use -- also great. Wind and Sea is a really good blend that captures the Sunset feel. I'm looking forward to trying more.

On top of that, the baked goods are tasty. I wasn't expecting a sausage roll; now I'm willing to suck down the extra fifteen minutes in my commute for the sake of picking one up every few mornings. So good. 

Finally, it's just a beautiful space. The unfinished wood trim carries outside to the benches, the windows open the shop up to the outside, and I can easily imagine spending a lot of time here. Also you can feel the joy that Michael and Lauren feel at opening their dream.

Really happy to have Andytown in the Sunset. May it become an institution.
author: Bryant D.

description: I am a fan. This neighborhood is in desperate need for quality businesses. Andytown fits the bill. A bright clean sleek interior that is inviting. The Staff is friendly and welcoming. Coffee and Irish treats are delicious. I recommend the Snowy Plover drink! An interesting concoction that is a real surprise. The Scones and Irish Bread are scrumptious, while traditional they also have a unique twist to them. I look forward to visiting frequently and getting to know more of my neighbors.
author: Margot M.

description: I am moving to this area, and am super relieved to find an excellent coffee shop blocks away. The line is, deservedly, out the door all the time, so plan accordingly. I've worked at a specialty coffee shop in Santa Barbara (The French Press, yelp it), and had a ton of great coffee from all the mentionables: Four Barrel, Blue Bottle, Ritual, St. Frank, Verve, Stumptown, Bar Nine (in LA), Go Get Em Tiger/GnB (in LA), Black Top (LA also), Huckleberry (Denver), ETC. Andytown does a fantastic job on roasting and brewing. The 4 times I've been there, the espresso is ON POINT. I love drinking espresso and when it's this good, I usually order 2, 3, and even 4 espressos for a single sitting. The taste is bright, clean, deep, sweet and savory, chocolatey, etc. The brewed coffee is really good, too. We bought a bag and brewed and drank all of it in just like three days or so. Make this place a destination when you're in this part of town or visiting or whatever. Only bummer is no vegan pastries, but it's a coffee shop first, bakery second, so 5 stars woop woop!
author: Adam L.

description: I usually love all the corn muffins at Andytown and am willing to wait for at least the half hour wait. But today I found a fine blond hair baked into my peach raspberry muffin. I called and the woman who answered was apologetic and offered to give me another one. But that wasn't what I wanted after seeing that hair literally baked into the middle of my muffin.. I would think food preparation policy would require the staff to wear their hair tidy or in a net when cooking or baking. It just completely turned me off to see that hair.
author: Flo H.

description: This place is a great local coffee store located in the Sunset district.  The customer service is great here and everyone is friendly.  I definitely recommend the baked goods such as the sausage roll and the blueberry corn muffin.  Their pastries are baked onsite and they are usually straight out of the oven when you get them.  Great breakfast spot around the neighborhood.
author: Brian C.

description: I came here to get the Snowy Plover. When friends describe this drink they say "It's interesting. I don't hate it, but I don't love it either." I tried it and I hated it. It's essentially an americano with sparking water. I don't even like normal americanos so why did I think I would like this one? I didn't, it's weird and not a good taste. I did really love the whipped cream they make in house that they put on top, that was probably the only tasty part of the drink. I also got to share the iced mocha my girlfriend ordered which I did enjoy. Next time I come I will just get a latte and a pastry but as for the Snowy Plover, it gets two thumbs down. I will update review after my next visit where I try something else.
author: Jeromy G.

description: There's always a long line, but it's worth the wait. All the muffins and bake goods are freshly made. The drinks are fantastic, especially the latte and snowy plover. Highly recommended!
author: Connie T.

description: Wow, what an awesome experience! Fantastic Latte and the Snowy Plover while not something I would get everyday is a real treat and should be tried. The food here is as good as the coffee. The staff is top notch and super friendly but without trying to be your friend or obtrusive. This may be my favorite coffee stop in the Bay Area and that is saying a lot.
author: John P.

description:
Snowy plover (pellegrino, espresso, topped with homemade whipped cream) was unusual, delicious, and refreshing.

I'm a coffee geek and was disappointed by their drip coffee
author: Ben S.

description: Their raspberry and pear corn muffin is amazing. I dream of it.
author: Sawsan D.

description: One of the best cappuccino's in the city.  Fresh baked goods are excellent and varied.  Tiny, but top notch
author: John H.

description:
I'm a hard-to-please coffee snob, but this place earned its 5 stars.

One of the best cappuccinos I've ever had, and the bacon and cheddar sandwich was excellent. 

Long line, but worth the wait! I'm afraid I didn't like the Snowy Plover, though -- I had to try it because it's so different, but it didn't really work for me. Certainly unique!
author: Michael C.

description: Super bright atmosphere. Decor is very white, with wood accents, big incandescent bulbs; very New American. Some of the best pre-made drip coffee I've had. They have their own bakery, and their chocolate chip cookies are especially good - chewy but firm, small enough that you don't feel gross after eating one, and perfectly salty-sweet.
author: Zach K.

description: Excellent coffee, great attention to detail, friendly staff and owners who take pride in their craft. What more could you want from your neighborhood coffee shop?
author: Mattheus K.

description: Good coffee, good prices.  Solid blackberry corn muffin as well.  Will definitely be back to try the snowy plower.
author: Sam H.

description: Ex blue bottle folks opening up a great coffee option in the outer sunset.  Picked up some small batch house roasted beans for home.  Great space and coffee.
author: Ryan T.

description: My new favorite coffee shop in SF. Friendly staff, gorgeous minimalist-meets-Outerlands space, delicious peach sweet goat cheese muffin (gluten free!) and rich cappuccinos.
author: Star S.

description: I was there getting a cappuccino for hubby for father day.. Saw a lot of people starring on a white wall... Then I looked at the same wall.. It was a projected TV playing the World Cup in Brazil...  Very nice... Although I never tried the coffee over there, but it has good aroma.  Pastry is quite tasty.
author: D F.

description: Love andytown! Coffee is amazing as well as the treats. Great small local shop...everything is made in house and deliciously! Very friendly people. Highly recommend it...snowy plovers are life changing.
author: Erin A.

description: I went for my first time today and Andytown is amazing! I got the Snowy Plover and loved it! Tip: Mix the whipping cream in with the coffee. It tasted great, the service was amazing as frazzled as I was, and it was quick as could be! Everything at Andytown, the decor, the food, the staff was amazing and I can't recommend this place more!
author: Carina M.

description: Delicious coffee! I'm a HUGE fan of the snowy plover. I also really enjoy their scrumptious scones. Not only do they do coffee really well, but the owners are ridiculously nice :) I live in the Outer Sunset and I am so happy that we now get to enjoy a place like Andytown. Contrary to some of these other yelp reviews, the sunset really isn't in the middle of nowhere. San Francisco is a small city folks. But, I will continue to let others makes their assumptions about this gem of a neighborhood. It's pretty special and I love it here :)
author: Abby G.

description: An instant favorite. This place has everything, nicely balanced espresso, snowy plovers (delicious bubbly with espresso topped with fresh whipped cream), an interior that's meticulously hand crafted, woodwork done by the owner, tasty in house baked goods, and friendly service that is as thoughtful as the space they've made
author: Matt B.

description: Had the Snowy Plover, and it met my expectations based on other reviews.  Fizzy, creamy coffee--a really interesting experience.  I also got a piece of the soda bread with butter and cheese, a cocoa nib and salt cookie, and a strawberry corn muffin.  All items were delicious.  Ambiance was modern yet inviting.  Staff was super pleasant.  Definitely a new favorite spot, and it doesn't hurt that it's close to home!
author: Kandi K.

description: My friend got me to try their strawberry corn muffin. It was really good. Now I'm addicted to the snowy plover. I'm not a big coffee drinker, but that was is really good. It did get some used to after a few sips cause of the bubbles, but having it sweetened with their whip cream was very good. Also I got the raspberry corn bread with an apricot fill. It was yummy. I think this is my new place to go to.
author: Melanie T.

description: Great local place to get freshly roasted coffee and tasty baked treats.  Only downside is avoiding peak hours to try to miss the adoring crowd.
author: Don G.

description: Snowy Plover is really good, never think espresso with sparkling soda and whipped cream can mixed!!!  They also have good pastries... and yummy Italian soda.  I'd recommend the chocolate eclairs.. love this place!
author: Lan P.

description: I had the most amazing peach, goat cheese scone at Andytown, and I didn't think I even liked scones. Their lattes are perfection. The service is warm and fast. My pup appreciates the dog cookies and water dish.
author: Jessie S.

description: Great staff, parking, and snowy plover. 5 stars.
author: Connie C.

description:
I visited Andytown for the first time today. Michael and Lauren made me three amazing drinks, a house espresso, a two-bean blend drip coffee & their original snowy plover iced beverage. They also helped me choose which beans I wanted to buy with helpful descriptions and recommendations of their single-origin coffees.

Thank you Andytown! I will be back soon!
author: Kelly S.

description: i loved the snowy plover. i wish they offered a bigger size of it. i drink way too much coffee and i can't stop, so, like, a 32oz would be nice : )
author: Mae I.

description: Great coffee shop, the owners are fantastic and the coffee is delicious (especially the mochas!)
author: Jesse P.

description: Ok. I may be biased, but I absolutely love this place! I love the owners, I love the ambiance,  & I love everything that comes from the espresso machine! I can truly hang out here all day!! Lauren & Michael have not missed one detail about making you feel right at home. Kudos to the max.
author: Kat M.

description: Andytown is hands down the best coffee roaster not only in SF but on the whole west coast! If you haven't tried them yet, you are missin' out! They are now my "go to" almost every day. Plus, not only is their coffee delicious with a one of a kind flavor, their baked goods- specifically their fruit corn muffins, are TO DIE FOR! All of their baked goods melt in your mouth and taste even better paired with their perfectly roasted and flavorful coffee. PLUS, their staff is kind and their effort to take care of the coffee shines through with every cup. Go to Andytown! You will not be disappointed.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Now we're talking! The Outer Sunset's swank, clean-lines, caffeinated pride and glory has arrived!! As a self-proclaimed (and popularly acknowledged) coffee snob, I say --without trepidation-- that Andytown Coffee Roasters is, hands-down, the finest damn cuppa in the over-coffeed city of Sam Framcisco.  Michael, Lauren and the team understand crema, and pay homage to ristretto.
