They roast their own, on-site, and pull masterful shots (on a Kees van der Westen, Idrocompresso, nonetheless) so you are guaranteed the freshest, purest and smoothest pour in town.  Their traditional and Irish-inspired handmade pastries are delicious, and include a daily selection of gluten-free corn (+fresh, local fruit) muffins, savory sausage rolls, soda bread and a mascarpone/berry "Patriot" scone, which will knock your red-white-and-blues to the moon.  Note the modern, yet organic appointments, like bamboo serving trays and hand-thrown mugs. For a novel treat, try the Snowy Plover (fizzy H2O, espresso and house-made whipped cream).  This place has caught on, so your wait may include some sidewalk time, but the crew are fast, clever and friendly, so squeeze in and hold on. You're in for a bonafide and luxurious cuppa joe. Dig it! Indoor seating is limited, but don't be afraid to squeeze in at the gorgeous community table in the front.  Most often a seat is open outside.
author: Holly D.

description: I don't even drink coffee, but after I saw a friend's Snowy Plover on Facebook, biking to Andytown became my new weekend ritual.  Wonderful drinks and pastries, and the friendliest staff.  Definitely worth the trek.
author: Brenton S.

description: In-house bakery makes great pastries.  Their coffee is really good.  The snowy plover is tasty but probably not to everyone's taste. Worth trying.
author: S Y.

description: I had the snowy plover (iced coffee with fresh whipped cream) when I was there and it's definitely different but a still a great coffee option. I would get is again. I would also recommend trying their homemade scones. I'm not a big scone person usually, but these ones were exceptional. They have different seasonal combinations as well.
author: M T.

description: Andytown is fantastic.  Great coffee, awesome gluten-free strawberry cornmeal muffins ...and the SNOWY PLOVER.  So, so good.
author: Susan C.

description: Wow.  I just tried the sausage roll, cheddar scallion scone, and a cafe au lait, and they were delicious.  I shared the sausage roll with a few people and they agreed.  (By the way, thank you to everyone on yelp who recommended them.)  I came around 7:30 a.m. today so there was no line.  The guy at the counter was nice and fast.  There was happy music in the background that made me feel good and left a smile on my face.  And, the place was really clean.  It's small, but there are a few seats inside and outside.  They also individually bag each sausage roll and cheddar scallion scone so you don't have to worry about someone touching dirty money and then your food.  I'll be coming back.
author: M. N.

description: I am obsessed with this place! They have the most delicious espresso and make their drinks with so much care; every one comes out perfect. Their scones, muffins, and soda bread are also amazing. I love Andytown and will return frequently!
author: Chloe A.

description: Pretty good coffee with yummy scones and muffins.  Line to wait is sometimes long and parking can often be tough so probably better for locals or ride your bike here.
author: R S.

description: I went to Andytown's opening party today and could not have been more impressed! Not only was the coffee perfect, but the currant scone was delicious. The owners were warm and welcoming and the vibe cozy--even though it's tiny, it's a great gathering place. I wish I lived closer; this would easily become my favorite go-to coffee shop. I will definitely be back to try the housemade soda bread!
author: Kim F.

description: Cute, cozy oceanside coffee house in the Outer Sunset. Came by on a Sunday late morning to a long line (there's a church across the street so they get lots of consistent customers after their service), but it moves.  Favorite part about the experience was the shop's interior - feels really cozy, warm, open, airy, cheerful (great use of white and reclaimed wood) even on foggy mornings.  If eating/drinking in, they serve your order on these cute wooden platters.  We had the cheddar/corn/jalapeno muffin and the strawberry scone - both came out of the oven fresh and they were lovely - definitely recommend.  I hear all their baked goods are excellent so I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong.  We also ordered the Snowy Plover and an Almond Milk Mocha - both of which we weren't too thrilled about.  I really think the Snowy Plover is an acquired taste - a lot of folks rave about it (here in the reviews and in the shop as well) but, I unfortunately, could only get half of it down.  Just not a fan of sparkling water and espresso.  The almond milk and mocha had a slightly off after taste - but I really think that maybe mochas can't be done well with almond milk...we've tried that combo at a few great coffee shops and it just didn't work out.  I'll have to go back and just try their coffee with milk - and I would def come back!
author: Janelle H.

description: best iced mocha ive ever had. came here after eating at old mandarin islamic chinese.
author: Dave G.

description: The snowy plover, the sausage roll, currant scones...yummmm.  I seriously can't stop craving the snowy plover, which reminds me of Bibi Caffes they used to import to the US.  However, this is so much better and delicious with the Pellegrino and fresh whipped cream.
author: Heather C.

description: I had a Cappuccino today. It was pretty good! The barista was really friendly and professional. The location is great for parking. One table for three or four people at the front door and two or three tiny tables attached to the wall inside along the counter. Then there are few more table outside. I couldn't try baked goods today, but I will do next time. I really liked this cafe.
author: Micky T.

description: I'm so happy to have found Andytown! The coffee is good, and it's awesome that they roast it in house. The space is open and bright, and the staff is cheerful and attentive. The pastries are amazing as well. Finally, a neighborhood café that I actually want to go to!
author: Vernon S.

description: My husband brought home an almondmilk latte and I had a couple sips. It was amazing. Somebody stop me, I'm going to fall off the caffeine abstinence wagon!  So far I have been strong, but they're just up the street . . . .
author: Kate V.

description: LOVE this place! Finally, a great coffee shop in this hood. The owners and staff are so friendly and the vibe is just really cool. Low key and casual. Good baked goods, coffee and tea. Great decor.
author: Charlie B.

description: Best coffee and muffins around! That's saying a lot in this city. This has it all, a clean place and friendly staff.
author: Steve Y.

description: A great coffee place that roasts their own beans! Such a nice comfy place with great people.
author: Lorraine M.
